[TextBlock(text='Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found related documents about Java exit code errors with IBM Rational products, but **I did not find a document specifically addressing the "exit code = -1" error when launching IBM Rational Software Architect (RSA)**.

The documents I found discuss similar Java exit code errors with IBM Rational products:

**Exit code 8096 errors** (related but different error code):

1. **RTC Eclipse Client linking issue** [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/381d53b0.md]
   - Error: "Java was started but returned exit code=8096"
   - Cause: Using 64-bit Eclipse (64-bit Eclipse cannot fulfill CQ-RTC linking)
   - Solution: Use a 32-bit Eclipse instance

2. **Rational Business Developer with RTC** [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/93b6af1d.md]
   - Error: "Java was started but returned exit code=8096"
   - Cause: Video driver issues (conflicting driver versions)
   - Solution: Update video driver to newest version

messages.result:
Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found related documents about Java exit code errors with IBM Rational products, but **I did not find a document specifically addressing the "exit code = -1" error when launching IBM Rational Software Architect (RSA)**.

The documents I found discuss similar Java exit code errors with IBM Rational products:

**Exit code 8096 errors** (related but different error code):

1. **RTC Eclipse Client linking issue** [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/381d53b0.md]
   - Error: "Java was started but returned exit code=8096"
   - Cause: Using 64-bit Eclipse (64-bit Eclipse cannot fulfill CQ-RTC linking)
   - Solution: Use a 32-bit Eclipse instance

2. **Rational Business Developer with RTC** [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/93b6af1d.md]
   - Error: "Java was started but returned exit code=8096"
   - Cause: Video driver issues (conflicting driver versions)
   - Solution: Update video driver to newest version

⚠️ **The knowledge base contains information about exit code 8096 errors with IBM Rational products, but does not contain specific documentation about exit code -1 errors when launching Rational Software Architect.** The troubleshooting approaches for exit code 8096 (checking 32-bit vs 64-bit compatibility, updating drivers) may provide some guidance, but I cannot confirm they apply to exit code -1 without specific documentation.

    11→Version 8.5 Refresh Pack 7 for the IBM Business Process Manager products [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24041575]
    12→
    13→SUBSCRIBE
    14→You can track all active APARs for this component.
    15→
    16→APAR STATUS
    17→ * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.
    18→
    19→
    20→
    21→
    22→ERROR DESCRIPTION
    23→ *  Adding members to or removing members from an internal group
    24→   fails on a system where you use process attachments or case
    25→   folders. In the log, you see an error similar to this error:
    26→   com.lombardisoftware.core.TeamWorksException: Error updating
    27→   teams. Details: CWTDS0000E: An unexpected failure occurred.
    28→   Details: 'FNRCE0004: E_BAD_INDEX: The index specified does not
    29→   reference a valid property or list element.'
    30→   Explanation: An exception was thrown.
    31→   Action: Check the server log files.
    32→   at com.lombardisoftware.bpd.runtime.engine.CaseHelper.
    33→     updateContentEngineTeams(CaseHelper.java:1415)
    34→   at com.lombardisoftware.bpd.runtime.engine.CaseHelper.
    35→     updateContentEngineTeams(CaseHelper.java:1367)
    36→   at com.lombardisoftware.server.ejb.security.InternalGroupsCore.
    37→     removeUserFromInternalGroup(InternalGroupsCore.java:260)
    38→   at com.lombardisoftware.server.ejb.security.InternalGroupsCore.
    39→     removeUserFromInternalGroup(InternalGroupsCore.java:230)
    40→   ...
    41→
    42→
    43→
    44→
    45→
    46→
    47→LOCAL FIX
    48→
    49→PROBLEM SUMMARY
    50→ *  When you update the membership of an internal group, your
    51→   updates must be propagated to the IBM BPM document store to also
    52→   update the authorization of process attachments and case
    53→   folders. This operation is done in bulk on all teams that
    54→   contain the internal group. If this operation affects a team as
    55→   well as its manager team, the operation might fail.
    56→
    57→
    58→
    59→
    60→
    61→
    62→PROBLEM CONCLUSION
    63→ *  A fix that ensures permission updates do not fail will be
    64→   included in an IBM BPM V8.5.6.0 cumulative fix.

Do one of the following:\\\\n     If you are a returning customer, sign in.\\\\n     If you are a new customer, register.\\\\n 2.  Under Find it fast, click Download software.\\\\n 3.  If the Software download & media access window appears, click I agree.\\\\n 4.  In the Find downloads & media window, select the download you want and click Continue.\\\\n 5.  Under Select criteria, select a language and one or more platforms.\\\\n 6.  Under Download options, select the options you want, and click Continue.\\\\n 7.  Under Review “Current version” downloads, expand Current version and under Description, select the download you want, expand it and select the items you want.\\\\n 8.  If applicable, under Select optional downloads, expand and select the items you want.\\\\n 9.  Under Review downloading specifics, update the Download method or the Download location, if you want, and then click I agree, and click Download now.\\\\n 10. In the Initial Setup window, change the Default download location, if you want.\\\\n 11. If you are prompted, click OK to create the directory where you want the downloaded items to be stored.\\\\n 12. Click OK to begin the download.\\\\n\\\\nWhen the download has finished, Download complete appears in the Download Director window. The required and optional parts for each product are listed and described in detail. There is an option to download each licensed eAssembly. Each eAssembly contains all of the required and optional downloads needed for a particular product and platform combination.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nDownloading and assembling the product  *\\\\n\\\\n1. Download all of the parts that you need, both required and optional.\\\\n2. Unpack each of the parts into a single temporary directory on your system.\\\\n3. Follow the instructions in the Quick Start Guide to install the product. \\"../my-agent-kb/docs/redis-docs/operate/oss_and_stack/management/security/acl.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"ACL\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"When ACLs are useful\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"The Redis ACL, short for Access Control List, is the feature that allows certain\\\\nconnections to be limited in terms of the commands that can be executed and the\\\\nkeys that can be accessed. The way it works is that, after connecting, a client\\\\nis required to provide a username and a valid password to authenticate. If authentication succeeded, the connection is associated with a given\\\\nuser and the limits the user has. Redis can be configured so that new\\\\nconnections are already authenticated with a \\\\\\"default\\\\\\" user (this is the\\\\ndefault configuration). Configuring the default user has, as a side effect,\\\\nthe ability to provide only a specific subset of functionalities to connections\\\\nthat are not explicitly authenticated.\\\\n\\\\nIn the default configuration, Redis 6 (the first version to have ACLs) works\\\\nexactly like older versions of Redis. Every new connection is\\\\ncapable of calling every possible command and accessing every key, so the\\\\nACL feature is backward compatible with old clients and applications. Also\\\\nthe old way to configure a password, using the **requirepass** configuration\\\\ndirective, still works as expected. However, it now\\\\nsets a password for the default user.\\\\n\\\\nThe Redis [`AUTH`](/commands/auth) command was extended in Redis 6, so now it is possible to\\\\nuse it in the two-arguments form:\\\\n\\\\n    AUTH <username> <password>\\\\n\\\\nHere\'s an example of the old form:\\\\n\\\\n    AUTH <password>\\\\n\\\\nWhat happens is that the username used to authenticate is \\\\\\"default\\\\\\", so\\\\njust specifying the password implies that we want to authenticate against\\\\nthe default user. This provides backward compatibility.\\\\n\\\\nBefore using ACLs, you may want to ask yourself what\'s the goal you want to\\\\naccomplish by implementing this layer of protection. Normally there are\\\\ntwo main goals that are well served by ACLs:\\\\n\\\\n1. You want to improve security by restricting the access to commands and keys, so that untrusted clients have no access and trusted clients have just the minimum access level to the database in order to perform the work needed. For instance, certain clients may just be able to execute read only commands.\\\\n2. You want to improve operational safety, so that processes or humans accessing Redis are not allowed to damage the data or the configuration due to software errors or manual mistakes. For instance, there is no reason for a worker that fetches delayed jobs from Redis to be able to call the [`FLUSHALL`](/commands/flushall) command.\\\\n\\\\nAnother typical usage of ACLs is related to managed Redis instances. Redis is\\\\noften provided as a managed service both by internal company teams that handle\\\\nthe Redis infrastructure for the other internal customers they have, or is\\\\nprovided in a software-as-a-service setup by cloud providers. query: How to install Packaging utility? How to install Packaging utility?
answer:
Based on the documents retrieved from the knowledge base, here's how to install IBM Packaging Utility:

## Installation Methods

**Method 1: Install without downloading files (requires Internet access)**

If IBM Installation Manager is already installed:
1. You need an IBM user name and password (register at http://www.ibm.com/account/profile)
2. Use the Packaging Utility repository on www.ibm.com to install directly
3. Installation Manager will access the latest version automatically

**Method 2: Install from downloaded package**

1. Download the installer package: `pu.offering.disk.platform_version.zip` (where platform indicates your operating system)
2. Extract the compressed file to a directory (e.g., C:\temp)
3. The package includes both Packaging Utility and Installation Manager
4. Run the install command from the extracted package

**Method 3: Install via Installation Manager GUI**

If Installation Manager is not installed:
1. Download and install IBM Installation Manager first
2. Start IBM Installation Manager
3. On the Start page, click "Install Packages"
4. Select IBM Packaging Utility
5. Follow the wizard pages to complete installation

**Installation Modes Available:**
- Wizard mode (GUI)
- Console mode (text-based)
- Command line mode (using imcl commands)

## Prerequisites

- Review the Detailed System Requirements before installation
- Packaging Utility is available in 64-bit mode
- For updates, you need IBM Installation Manager version 1.0.0.5 or later

## Download Location

Download from Fix Central: http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral (search for IBM Packaging Utility)

[TextBlock(text='Based on the documents retrieved from the knowledge base, here's how to install IBM Packaging Utility:

## Installation Methods

**Method 1: Install without downloading files (requires Internet access)**

If IBM Installation Manager is already installed:
1. You need an IBM user name and password (register at http://www.ibm.com/account/profile)
2. Use the Packaging Utility repository on www.ibm.com to install directly
3. Installation Manager will access the latest version automatically

**Method 2: Install from downloaded package**

1. Download the installer package: `pu.offering.disk.platform_version.zip` (where platform indicates your operating system)
2. Extract the compressed file to a directory (e.g., C:\temp)
3. The package includes both Packaging Utility and Installation Manager
4. Run the install command from the extracted package

**Method 3: Install via Installation Manager GUI**

If Installation Manager is not installed:
1. Download and install IBM Installation Manager first
2. Start IBM Installation Manager
3. On the Start page, click "Install Packages"
4. Select IBM Packaging Utility
5. Follow the wizard pages to complete installation

**Installation Modes Available:**
- Wizard mode (GUI)
- Console mode (text-based)
- Command line mode (using imcl commands)

## Prerequisites

- Review the Detailed System Requirements before installation
- Packaging Utility is available in 64-bit mode
- For updates, you need IBM Installation Manager version 1.0.0.5 or later

## Download Location

Download from Fix Central: http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral (search for IBM Packaging Utility)

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/30083db3.md > INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS]
[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/289c423d.md > INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS]')]

messages.result:
Based on the documents retrieved from the knowledge base, here's how to install IBM Packaging Utility:

## Installation Methods

**Method 1: Install without downloading files (requires Internet access)**

If IBM Installation Manager is already installed:
1. You need an IBM user name and password (register at http://www.ibm.com/account/profile)
2. Use the Packaging Utility repository on www.ibm.com to install directly
3. Installation Manager will access the latest version automatically

**Method 2: Install from downloaded package**

1. Download the installer package: `pu.offering.disk.platform_version.zip` (where platform indicates your operating system)
2. Extract the compressed file to a directory (e.g., C:\temp)
3. The package includes both Packaging Utility and Installation Manager
4. Run the install command from the extracted package

**Method 3: Install via Installation Manager GUI**

If Installation Manager is not installed:
1. Download and install IBM Installation Manager first
2. Start IBM Installation Manager
3. On the Start page, click "Install Packages"
4. Select IBM Packaging Utility
5. Follow the wizard pages to complete installation

**Installation Modes Available:**
- Wizard mode (GUI)
- Console mode (text-based)
- Command line mode (using imcl commands)

## Prerequisites

- Review the Detailed System Requirements before installation
- Packaging Utility is available in 64-bit mode
- For updates, you need IBM Installation Manager version 1.0.0.5 or later

## Download Location

Download from Fix Central: http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral (search for IBM Packaging Utility)

query: Help with Security Bulletin: IBM WebSphere MQ is affected by a privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2017-1612) I need to understand details regarding Security Bulletin: IBM WebSphere MQ is affected by a privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2017-1612).
answer:
❌ **Unable to find information about CVE-2017-1612 in the knowledge base.**

I searched the knowledge base extensively for CVE-2017-1612 (IBM WebSphere MQ privilege escalation vulnerability), but this specific CVE is not documented in the available security bulletins.

The knowledge base contains several IBM WebSphere MQ security bulletins from 2017, including:
- CVE-2017-1283 (shared memory leak in dynamic queues)
- CVE-2016-8971 (segmentation fault vulnerability)
- CVE-2013-0248 (Apache Commons FileUpload symlink attack)

However, CVE-2017-1612 specifically is not present in the indexed documents.

**Recommendation:** For detailed information about CVE-2017-1612, please refer to:
- IBM's official Security Bulletin portal
- IBM X-Force Exchange vulnerability database
- The National Vulnerability Database (NVD)

[Source: Search performed across docs/ragbench-techqa/ security bulletins]

Determine the WAS version used by your CCRC WAN server. Navigate to the CCRC profile directory (either the profile you specified when installing ClearCase, or <ccase-home>/common/ccrcprofile), then execute the script: bin/versionInfo.sh (UNIX) or bin\\\\\\\\versionInfo.bat (Windows). The output includes a section \\\\\\"IBM WebSphere Application Server\\\\\\". Make note of the version listed in this section.\\\\n 2. Identify the latest available fix (per the bulletin listed above) for the version of WAS used for CCRC WAN server.\\\\n 3. Apply the appropriate WebSphere Application Server fix directly to your CCRC WAN server host. No ClearCase-specific steps are necessary.\\\\n\\\\nFor 7.0.x, 7.1.x and earlier releases, IBM recommends upgrading to a fixed, supported version/release/platform of the product. query:
What things are important to consider when installing a fix pack for IIB running on a multi-instance environment? I am planning to apply a fix pack to my current version of IBM Integration Bus (IIB) using multi-instance brokers and I am looking for any important information regarding the process.

For example:

 

- installation and verification tasks
 

- is it possible to back out this fix pack in case there are issues
 

- any specific tasks for multi instance configuration
answer:
❌ **Unable to find relevant documentation.**

The knowledge base contains IBM Integration Bus (IIB) security bulletins that mention fix packs and their availability, but does not contain detailed documentation about:

- **Installation procedures** for fix packs in multi-instance environments
- **Verification tasks** after fix pack installation
- **Rollback/back-out procedures** if issues occur
- **Multi-instance broker-specific configuration** steps during fix pack application

The documents found only provide:
- Information about which fix packs contain specific security fixes (APARs)
- Links to IBM Fix Central for downloading fix packs
- General statements like "For unsupported versions of the product, IBM recommends upgrading to a fixed, supported version"

⚠️ **For the detailed installation procedures, verification steps, rollback capabilities, and multi-instance-specific tasks you're looking for, you'll need to consult:**
- IBM's official IIB product documentation
- The specific fix pack readme files from IBM Fix Central
- IBM Support technotes for multi-instance broker maintenance procedures

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/ef54aa23.md, docs/ragbench-techqa/f0a49536.md, docs/ragbench-techqa/7d8aa1b1.md]

CUSTOMERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL SECURITY VULNERABILITY.\\\\n\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -4.5645,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"30472540\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"30472540-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/30472540.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n You are developing an application solution with WebSphere Message Broker (WMB) or IBM Integration Bus (IIB) and are having problems with the Global Cache feature.\\\\n\\\\nThis MustGather document explains how to troubleshoot this problem by yourself, how to generate diagnostic data when the problem is happening, how to collect the available data from your system, and how to share that data with IBM support.\\\\n\\\\nENVIRONMENT\\\\nThese instructions are for WebSphere Message Broker or IBM Integration Bus on AIX, HP-UX, Linux, and Solaris systems.\\\\nReturn to the WMB / IIB MustGather index [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21209857] for other systems.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\n\\\\nSTEP 1: SELF-GUIDED TROUBLESHOOTING\\\\n\\\\n 1. Understand the problem that is occurring.  * Consider using the Test Client in trace and debug mode [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSKM8N_8.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/af52260_.htm].\\\\n     * A user level trace [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=849&uid=swg21177321#1] is intended to assist users with understanding how their ESQL is processed.\\\\n       It will also show a high level view of the message flow behavior.\\\\n     * The product documentation contains several suggestions for Monitoring the Global Cache [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bn23786_.htm].\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2.\\\\n 3. Locate the errors.  * Global Cache interactions are logged in the Global Cache Activity Log [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bj23784_.htm].\\\\n     * Informational messages and unhandled exceptions are written to the IIB Syslog [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSKM8N_8.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/an04230_.htm]. This will also contain a number of BIP71** messages relating to startup/connection of cache components, and whether any of them have failed.\\\\n     * Some messages may be written to the \'stderr\' and \'stdout\' files [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSKM8N_8.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/au14165_.htm], located under the Broker\'s (Integration Node\'s) workpath.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 4.\\\\n 5. Check for known issues and solutions.  * General information regarding the Global Cache [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bc23789_.htm] is available in the product documentation, as well as instructions on how to configure the cache [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bn23780_.htm] via the provided tooling.\\\\n     * Review how to access the Global Cache from a JavaCompute node [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bc23770_.htm].\\\\n     * The IIB development and support teams regularly update the IIB DeveloperWorks Blog with Global Cache solutions [https://developer.ibm.com/integration/blog/].\\\\n     * Your problem may have been discussed on the IIB dWAnswers forum [https://developer.ibm.com/answers/?community=iib].\\\\n     *\\\\n     *\\\\n     * WebSphere Message Broker support site\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nSTEP 2: COLLECT DATA\\\\n\\\\n 1.  mqsidc\\\\n     See: mqsidc usage instructions [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSKM8N_8.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bu46012_.htm]\\\\n      * When running the tool, select the option for \'Broker Collector\', when prompted.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2.\\\\n 3.\\\\n 4.  Global Cache details\\\\n     Export a current view of your Global Cache with these commands.\\\\n     See: mqsicacheadmin command [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSMKHH_9.0.0/com.ibm.etools.mft.doc/bn23783_.htm]  * mqsicacheadmin <broker> -c listHosts\\\\n      * mqsicacheadmin <broker> -c showMapSizes\\\\n      * mqsicacheadmin <broker> -c showPlacement\\\\n      * mqsireportproperties <broker> -b cachemanager -o CacheManager -r\\\\n      * mqsireportproperties <broker> -e <EG> -o ComIbmCacheManager -r\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 5.\\\\n 6.\\\\n 7.  Traces\\\\n     If the problem occurs during a runtime test or with the Toolkit test facility,\\\\n     an Execution Group service level trace [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=849&uid=swg21177321#2] can be used to gain a better understanding of the problem.\\\\n\\\\n     Note: For issues with Global Cache, broker service trace contains WXS trace. However, you may sometimes be advised to set a specific WXS trace string. Moreover, for startup issues, a WXS trace string must be specified, as well as enabling service trace.  * For startup issues, run this command prior to tracing:\\\\n        mqsichangeproperties <broker> -e <EG> -o ComIbmCacheManager -n overrideTraceSpec -v ObjectGrid*=fine=enabled\\\\n      * To capture all information (very verbose), run this command prior to tracing:\\\\n        mqsichangeproperties <broker> -e <EG> -o ComIbmCacheManager -n overrideTraceSpec -v ObjectGrid*=all=enabled\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 8.\\\\n 9.\\\\n 10. Project Interchange files for the problematic message flow\\\\n      * You can export your Message Flow and Java project(s) into an archive file for easy transmission to IBM Support.\\\\n        See: Exporting your message flow projects from the Toolkit [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21418121]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 11.\\\\n 12.\\\\n\\\\nATTENTION: A good problem description is one of the most important tools IBM needs to analyze your data!\\\\nWhen sending data to IBM, be sure to update your PMR or send a note with the following information:\\\\n\\\\n *  Tell us what errors you saw, where you saw them, and what time they happened Let us know if you made any changes to WebSphere Message Broker or the system before the problem Share any other observations which you think will help us to better understand the problem\\\\n\\\\nSTEP 3: SUBMIT DATA TO IBM\\\\n\\\\n * Use IBM Service Request [http://www.ibm.com/support/servicerequest/] to open or view a problem record with IBM.\\\\n * Send your data to IBM [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21392217] for further analysis.\\\\n\\\\nPlease see the IBM Software Support Handbook [http://www14.software.ibm.com/webapp/set2/sas/f/handbook/home.html] for more information on working with IBM support.\\\\n\\\\nBack to top\\\\n\\\\nPRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM\\\\n IIB WMB WXS GC\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": 0.0048,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"289c423d\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"289c423d-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/289c423d.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"IBM Packaging Utility; Only customers who have purchased Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1 can use this fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nHow to install the fix pack\\\\nIf you are not installing both components, skip the instructions regarding Decision Center or Decision Server.\\\\n\\\\n 1. For Decision Center, download 8.5.1-WS-ODM_DC-<OS>-FP001.zip, and extract its files. (Change <OS> to match your platform: AIX, HPUX, LINUX, OS400, SOLARIS, ZOS, or WIN32.)\\\\n 2. Extract the archive to a new folder, named WDC.\\\\n 3. For Decision Server, Download 8.5.1-WS-ODM_DS-<OS>-FP001.zip, and extract its files. (Change <OS> to match your platform: AIX, HPUX, LINUX, OS400, SOLARIS, ZOS, or WIN32.)\\\\n 4. Extract the archive to a new folder, named WDS.\\\\n\\\\nInstalling by using IBM Installation Manager:  1. Launch IBM Installation Manager.\\\\n 2. In the toolbar menu, open File > Preferences and do the following:\\\\n 3. Select repositories.  1. For Decision Center, click Add Repository.\\\\n     2. Browse to the extracted folder WDC\\\\\\\\updates.\\\\n     3. Select the file repository.config.\\\\n     4. For Decision Server, click Add Repository.\\\\n     5. Browse to the extracted folder WDS\\\\\\\\updates.\\\\n     6. Select the file repository.config.\\\\n     7. Make sure the repositories are selected in the Repositories list.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 4. Click Apply to save your changes, and click OK to close the Repositories list.\\\\n 5. Click Update to update your installation.\\\\n 6. Follow the instructions in the installation manager to complete the installation.\\\\n\\\\nInstalling by using the Installation Manager command line:  1. Locate the imcl command under <IM installation>/eclipse/tools.\\\\n 2. Run the commandimcl updateAll -repositories WDC/updates,WDS/updates -acceptLicense.\\\\n\\\\n * Use the option -installDirectory <install path of ODM 8.5.1> to update a specific installation.\\\\n * If you update only Decision Server or Decision Center, specify the repository accordingly.\\\\n\\\\nApplying the fix pack\\\\nAfter you install the fix pack, you might have to do additional steps to apply the fix pack in your environment. To complete the update, see When and how to apply a modification or fix pack [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665766].\\\\n\\\\nWarning:\\\\nIf you have installed interim fixes for Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1, you must uninstall the fixes before you can install this fix pack. You must also stop the Operational Decision Manager sample server for this installation. If you do not uninstall the fixes and stop the server, the installation of the fix pack will fail. security TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n How do we install maintenance for the embedded WebSphere Application Server and the IBM HTTP Server provided by IBM Tivoli Monitoring V6.2.3?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nIBM Tivoli Monitoring (ITM) provides embedded WebSphere Application Server (eWAS) and IBM HTTP Server (IHS) for use with Tivoli Enterprise Portal Sever (TEPS). For maintenance purposes it may be necessary to install fix packs and/or interim fixes for eWAS and IHS.\\\\nYou can use this procedure to install fix packs and interim fixes for a given eWAS and IHS version, but not to upgrade to a new eWAS or IHS version. For example, you can use it to install eWAS 7.0.0.43 on top of eWAS 7.0.0.29, but you cannot use it to install eWAS version 8.0 on top of eWAS version 7.0.\\\\nThe following table shows the different levels of eWAS and IHS that are provided by 6.2.3:\\\\n\\\\nITM version eWAS version IHS version 6.23.05.00 7.0.0.29 7.0.0.00 6.23.03.00 - 6.23.04.00 7.0.0.25 7.0.0.00 6.23.01.00 - 6.23.02.00 7.0.0.19 7.0.0.00 6.23.00.00 7.0.0.15 7.0.0.00\\\\nThis technote applies specifically to eWAS, not the full version of WebSphere. Further, this technote applies only to V6.2.3 of ITM.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nFollow these steps to install a new eWAS fix pack into your ITM environment:\\\\n\\\\nStep 1. Back up your ITM environment.\\\\nBack up your ITM environment using your local procedures.\\\\n\\\\nStep 2. Download the maintenance installation scripts.\\\\nDownload the appropriate eWAS/IHS maintenance installation script to the system where your TEPS resides.\\\\nUnix/Linux: Download ewasihsv7update.sh attached below. Ensure that the script has execute permission after it has been downloaded.\\\\nls -l ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nchmod a+rx ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nWindows: Download ewasihsv7update.cmd attached below.\\\\n\\\\nStep 3. Generate the list of files that need to be downloaded.\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd to generate the list of files that need to be downloaded and to create the temporary directory to hold them.\\\\nWhen the prompt beginning with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with n to exit the script so that you can download the required files.\\\\n\\\\nThe usage information for the command follows:\\\\n\\\\n * Unix:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.sh [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   If ewasihsv7update.sh was downloaded to CANDLEHOME/bin/, then the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: /tmp/ewasihsv7. You can specify a different location using the -w option.\\\\n   The -u option should only be used when installation of the UpdateInstaller to the documented default directory is not permitted.  *  AIX Default Location:\\\\n      /usr/IBM/WebSphere/UpdateInstaller Linux Default Location:\\\\n      /opt/IBM/WebSphere/UpdateInstaller\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * Windows:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.cmd [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   The ITM installation directory default value is the %CANDLE_HOME% value retrieved from the shell environment. Normally the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: %TEMP%\\\\\\\\ewasihsv7. You can specify a different location using the -w option.\\\\n   The -u option should only be used when installation of the UpdateInstaller to the documented default directory is not permitted.  * Windows Default Location:\\\\n      \\\\\\"C:\\\\\\\\Program Files\\\\\\\\IBM\\\\\\\\WebSphere\\\\\\\\UpdateInstaller\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStep 4: Download the files listed in the output from step 3 between the two delimiter lines starting with:\\\\n<><><><><><><><><><>\\\\nThere are a number of ways to download the files:  1. If a browser is available on the TEPS system:  * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Copy and paste the full line, one at a time, into the browser address bar and then hit enter.\\\\n        * Save the file to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2. If the wget utility is available, in a command prompt on the TEPS system:  * Change directory to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n     * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Enter the wget command followed by the copy and paste of the full line, and then hit enter.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. If the ftp utility is available, in a command prompt on the TEPS system:  * Change directory to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n     * Run the ftp command and connect to public.dhe.ibm.com as anonymous.\\\\n     * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Change the remote directory to parent directory of the file (starting with /software/websphere/appserv/support)\\\\n        * Get the file.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 4. Use any other method available to you to download the files.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStep 5. Install the UpdateInstaller and eWAS and IHS maintenance\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd again\\\\nWhen the prompt starting with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with y to allow the script to continue and perform the UpdateInstaller and maintenance installation actions.\\\\n\\\\nStep 6. Cleanup\\\\nRemove the temporary working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n\\\\nStep 7. Verify the update\\\\nRun run the cinfo/kincinfo command with the -i -z options, which should print out the following messages:\\\\n\\\\nOn a UNIX/Linux system,\\\\nwhere $CANDLEHOME is the IBM Tivoli Monitoring installation directory.\\\\n$CANDLEHOME/bin/cinfo -i -z\\\\nwill print the following iu and iw entries depending on the platform:\\\\n\\\\niu IBM HTTP Server\\\\naix536 Version: IFPI79343\\\\nPatch: 7.0.0.0-WS-WASJavaSDK-AixPPC64 APARs: IFPI84269\\\\n\\\\niu IBM HTTP Server\\\\nli6263 Version: 07.00.43.00\\\\nPatch: 7.0.0.43-WS-WASIHS-LinuxX32 APARs: IFPI82481\\\\n\\\\niw IBM TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThe Operational Decision Manager version numbers use the standard IBM formatV.R.M.Fwhich stands for Version.Release.Modification.Fixpack. See the V.R.M.F Maintenance Stream Delivery Vehicle terminology explanation [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] for more details.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix pack numbers are the third and fourth digits in the IBM product version number, for example: 8.5.M.F.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix packs include only bug fixes, so they do not affect the product functionality or your data.\\\\n\\\\nSee the following technotes to find out which update your installation need:\\\\n\\\\n * Finding the version of ODM product and fixes [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21627850] to determine the exact product versions that are installed on your machine.\\\\n\\\\n * Find the version of ODM components [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21400738] to determine the exact module or library versions that are deployed on your servers.\\\\n\\\\n * Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] to learn about the latest modification or fix pack that is available for your product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Operational Decision Manager detailed system requirements [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27023067] to verify that your configuration is supported with your current product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] to verify that your current version does not reach end of support in the near future.\\\\n\\\\nReferring to the last two documents above, you may find out that you need to migrate to the latest product version to ensure continued support of your applications. In that case, refer to technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725].\\\\n\\\\nThat being said, make sure to consider migrating to the latest version or release ( V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from the latest added features and improvements.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nAs with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:\\\\n\\\\n * Anticipate and avoid the risk of encountering defects already fixed.\\\\n * Apply the latest product improvements that are available (performance, for example).\\\\n * Maintain a serviceable system and be able to install an interim fix when required.\\\\n\\\\nWHEN TO UPDATE\\\\nThe latest modification or fix pack should be installed as soon as it is available.\\\\n\\\\nYou can subscribe to the IBM Support My Notifications [https://www.ibm.com/support/mynotifications] to be notified of any fix pack releases, and you can also bookmark the Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] page, which lists the latest modifications or fix packs.\\\\n\\\\nSee the technote Fix pack release notification for Operational Decision Manager [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593] to find out when a modification or fix pack will be available.\\\\n\\\\nBEFORE UPDATING\\\\n\\\\nThe databases used in the sample server are deleted and recreated during the update. If you are using those databases and want to save the existing content, perform the following steps before updating:\\\\n *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.\\\\n\\\\nA new profile is also created for the sample server, at the first server start following the installation of a modification or fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nIf you want to continue using the same ports, you must delete the existing profile prior. In the <ODM_HOME>/shared/bin folder, from the command line, run the command ../tools/ant/bin/ant forcedestroyprofile.\\\\n\\\\nNote: The sample server is not designed to be used in a production system. For a production system, you must create a dedicated profile and database that you update using the following steps.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING\\\\n\\\\nEach modification or fix pack page provides instructions on how to download and run the installer, in addition to providing a list of corrections that are included in the update.\\\\n\\\\nThe fix pack installation updates the following files and folders:  * JAR libraries in the installation directories, including <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\lib.\\\\n * EAR and WAR applications in the <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\applicationservers\\\\\\\\<App Server> folders.\\\\n\\\\nOnce this is done, you perform these tasks:  * Repackage your client applications with the up-to-date libraries.\\\\n * Reapply product customizations to the up-to-date Java EE modules (EARs and WARs).\\\\n\\\\nNote that all customizations you developed before the update, for example modifications of the descriptors, must be reapplied to the new, up-to-date EARs and WARs. It is a good idea to document and automate those customizations using scripts to make the process easier and error-proof.\\\\n\\\\nFinally, you must update the client applications and ODM modules on your server or servers with the same settings as you deployed previously. If you redeploy the application, follow again the documentation instructions to deploy all ODM modules to your servers [http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/dmanager/v8r5m1/topic/com.ibm.odm.distrib.config/topics/odm_distrib_config.html].\\\\n\\\\nKeep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING RULE EXECUTION SERVER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following applications in the application server:  *  jrules-res-xu-<server>.rar jrules-res-management-<server>.ear jrules-ssp-<server>.ear jrules-res-htds-<server>ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nNote: Updating the eXecution Unit RAR file requires a restart of the server.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE DECISION CENTER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following application in your application server:\\\\n * jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE THE EVENTS RUNTIME\\\\n\\\\n 1. Stop the event runtime application, wberuntimeear.\\\\n 2. Uninstall the following applications, if they exist:  * wbefileconnector\\\\n     * wbehttpconnector\\\\n     * wbejdbcconnector\\\\n     * wbejmsconnector\\\\n     * wbesoapconnector\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Update the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n 4. Start the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS\\\\n * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. See our technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725] for more information.\\\\n * For JRules 7.1, you can refer to the JRules 7.1 list of fix packs [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27019787] and also Upgrading JRules to the latest V7.1 fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21474292] to learn how to apply the fix packs. But note that JRules 7.1 reaches end of support in September 2015 (see the IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] page). To ensure continued product support, plan an upgrade to the latest product version before that date.\\\\n\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\\\n Fix pack release notification for ODM [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593 ]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Business Integration WebSphere ILOG JRules Maintenance Platform Independent 7.1, 7.0\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -2.389,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"30083db3\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"30083db3-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/30083db3.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"service release; If Installation Manager is installed, you can use the Packaging Utility repository on www.ibm.com to install or update Packaging Utility without downloading files. If Installation Manager is not installed, you must download the Packaging Utility files. Installation Manager is included in the Packaging Utility download packages.\\\\n\\\\nThe installer package for Packaging Utility is pu.offering.disk.platform_version.zip where platform indicates the operating system and version indicates the version of Packaging Utility. The installer package contains files for only one platform. Using this package, you can install Packaging Utility and Installation Manager by running the install command. You can also add this package as a repository in Installation Manager and use the package to update Packaging Utility.\\\\n\\\\nThe fix pack package for Packaging Utility is pu.update_version.zip. The fix pack contains files for all supported platforms. You can add this fix pack as a repository to update Packaging Utility. You cannot install Packaging Utility or Installation Manager with this fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nPackaging Utility is available in 64-bit mode. Review information information about bit mode for installation or updates: Packaging Utility bit mode information [https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSDV2W_1.8.0/com.ibm.cic.auth.ui.doc/topics/r_pu_bit_mode.html].\\\\n\\\\nFor more information about Packaging Utility and Installation Manager, Review the Installation Manager Knowledge Center [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSDV2W/im_family_welcome.html].\\\\n\\\\nINSTALL OR UPDATE PACKAGING UTILITY WITHOUT DOWNLOADING FILES\\\\nYou must have Internet access and Installation Manager must be installed to install or update Packaging Utility without downloading files. The Packaging Utility repository located on www.ibm.com contains the latest version of Packaging Utility.\\\\n\\\\nYou must have an IBM user name and password to access the repository. To register for these credentials, go to: http://www.ibm.com/account/profile.\\\\n\\\\nIBM Knowledge Center topics that are specified by operating system for installing and updating Packaging Utility. Description Recommended This is a service release. It contains new features as well as fixes for client-reported and internally found defects.\\\\n\\\\nTest Results\\\\n\\\\nClose [x]\\\\n\\\\nDEFINITIONS\\\\nRegression: An error in the Maintenance Delivery Vehicle [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] (MDV) that produces incorrect or unexpected behavior causing a supported feature to stop functioning as designed.\\\\nThis includes:\\\\n\\\\n * Coding errors that cause a regression\\\\n * Documentation or packaging problems that cause a regression\\\\n * Errors reported in a new function delivered in a MDV that cause a regression\\\\n\\\\nIncomplete: An error in the MDV has not regressed, but does not work as designed.\\\\nThis includes:\\\\n\\\\n * Fixed APARs which did not solve the original problem but did not break anything new\\\\n * APARs reporting documentation errors, such as readme errors, that cause problems applying an MDV but do not lead to a regression\\\\n\\\\nNotes:  * Regression and incomplete APARs are considered fix-in-error or MDV-in-error\\\\n * Definitions above apply only to valid APARs that result in product fixes (APARs returned as working-as-designed are not assessed for being fix-in-error)\\\\n * Issues in major releases due to new functionality do not apply in this definition\\\\n\\\\nThere are no known regressions to report.\\\\n\\\\nBack to top\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEMS query: Cognos Analytics - Images not displayed in PDF/Excel, working in HTML I've just completed an upgrade to Cognos Analytics 11.0.3. When running existing reports in HTML, the images are displayed but when I try to run them in PDF/Excel they are not.
answer:
Based on the knowledge base documentation, here's the solution for your Cognos Analytics 11.0.3 image display issue:

## Problem
Images display correctly in HTML reports but appear as empty black boxes (PDF) or missing picture icons (Excel) when exporting to PDF/Excel formats.

## Common Causes
1. **Folder permissions** not configured correctly for the image directory
2. **Image not in the specified directory**
3. **Directory doesn't exist** at the specified location

## Diagnosis Steps
Use Process Monitor to identify the root cause:

1. Download Process Monitor tool (run on the same machine as Cognos)
2. Open the report in Cognos Workspace
3. Load Process Monitor
4. Press Capture/Ctrl+E to stop event capture
5. Press Clear/Ctrl+X to remove recorded entries
6. Press Capture icon to start monitoring
7. Export the report to Excel 2007/PDF
8. Save the file
9. Press Capture again to stop
10. Press Find/Ctrl+F and search for your image name
11. Check the 'Result' column to see why the image couldn't be accessed

## Resolution

**If permission issue detected:**

1. Open IIS 7.5
2. Navigate to your Cognos installation root folder (e.g., C1021GA)
3. Double-click 'Authentication'
4. **Enable anonymous access**
5. Repeat steps 3-4 for the image folder and its parent folder
6. (Optional) Restrict child-folders like cgi-bin if security is a concern
7. Test the report export again

**If image/directory not found:**

Place the image/directory in the specified location.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/65ff6b3e.md]

This will be in the form of an empty black box (PDF) or will be a missing pictures icon (Excel).\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThere are a few common causes for this issue:\\\\n\\\\n 1. The permissions of the folder which contains the image, have not been configured correctly\\\\n 2. The image is not within the directory which is specified\\\\n 3. The directory where the image is meant to be stored, does not exist in the specified location\\\\n\\\\nDIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM\\\\nTo find out the root cause of this problem, you will need to use tools that monitor and record all actions attempted against the Operating System Registry.\\\\n\\\\nIn THIS scenario the tool used was Process Monitor and the Web Server was IIS 7.5.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 1. Office 365 is not a \'traditional\' single product. Instead, it is a subscription plan which allows users to download/run the very latest version of Office. In other words, customers who own Office 365 licenses will probably be upgrading their Excel versions (over time) as new MS Excel versions are released.\\\\n=> This makes it impossible to give a simple \'yes/no\' answer to the question to whether Cognos Analysis for Microsoft Excel or Planning Analytics for Microsoft Excel supports MS Office 365.\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nMicrosoft Office 365 is supported so long as all of the following are true:\\\\n\\\\n * The version of Office installed (for example Office 2016) as part of Office 365, is supported by that version of Cognos Analysis for Microsoft Excel or Planning Analytics for Microsoft Excel. For example:  * Cognos Analysis for Microsoft Excel 10.2.2 FP6 is the first release in that line that supports Excel 2016. All earlier versions of CAFE 10.2.2 (FP5 and earlier) support a maximum of Office 2013.\\\\n    * Planning Analytics for Microsoft Excel has supported Excel 2016 since its release.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * Using desktop-installed (downloaded) Office 365 (not the cloud version of Office 365), which has been installed via the traditional installation method or if you have installed via click to run.\\\\n\\\\n========================================\\\\n\\\\nFor the avoidance of doubt, Office 365 is not supported when running directly in the Cloud (instead of running on the desktop/laptop directly).\\\\n\\\\n========================================\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nQ1 - What are the different methods to install Microsoft Office 365?\\\\nMicrosoft Office 365 can be installed in two different ways:\\\\n\\\\n(1) Traditional method\\\\n\\\\n * This is sometimes called the \'MSI\' or \'Windows Installer\' method\\\\n * It is also sometimes known as the \'Volume License\' method\\\\n * The application is installed (and runs) natively/directly on the users client device\\\\n\\\\n(2) Click-to-run  * The user \\\\\\"streams\\\\\\" the portion of Office that they need (downloading extra portions as and when they need it). The software is running in an isolated \'Sandbox\' environment (\'virtual bubble\') on the computer.\\\\n\\\\nQ2 - What is \'Click to Run\' ?\\\\nClick-to-Run is a streaming and virtualization technology that is designed to significantly reduce the time that is required to download and use Office client products. Streaming allows users to begin to use a Click-to-Run product before the complete product is downloaded.\\\\n\\\\nClick-to-Run for Office 365 products are based on core virtualization and streaming Microsoft Application Virtualization ( App-V) technologies. Click-to-Run resources run in an isolated virtual environment on the local operating system.\\\\n\\\\nQ3 - How can I check if my installation is \'traditional\' or \'click to run\'?\\\\n * Method #1 (recommended)\\\\n\\\\n1. Then install MS Office via the traditional (MSI) method instead\\\\nor (b) Upgrade to a later version of Cognos Analysis for Microsoft Excel or Planning Analytics for Microsoft Excel which supports click to run (see above for caveats).\\"\\n  }\\n]\\n\\n[SEARCH NOTE] 以上为文档片段（chunks），可能不完整。如果 chunk 内容不足以完整回答问题（缺少具体步骤、命令、配置、代码），请用 Read(path) 读取对应文件获取完整上下文，严禁用通用知识补充。"}', is_error=None)]

[TextBlock(text="Based on the knowledge base documentation, here's the solution for your Cognos Analytics 11.0.3 image display issue:

## Problem
Images display correctly in HTML reports but appear as empty black boxes (PDF) or missing picture icons (Excel) when exporting to PDF/Excel formats.

## Common Causes
1. **Folder permissions** not configured correctly for the image directory
2. **Image not in the specified directory**
3. **Directory doesn't exist** at the specified location

## Diagnosis Steps
Use Process Monitor to identify the root cause:

1. Download Process Monitor tool (run on the same machine as Cognos)
2. Open the report in Cognos Workspace
3. Load Process Monitor
4. Press Capture/Ctrl+E to stop event capture
5. Press Clear/Ctrl+X to remove recorded entries
6. Press Capture icon to start monitoring
7. Export the report to Excel 2007/PDF
8. Save the file
9. Press Capture again to stop
10. Press Find/Ctrl+F and search for your image name
11. Check the 'Result' column to see why the image couldn't be accessed

## Resolution

**If permission issue detected:**

1. Open IIS 7.5
2. Navigate to your Cognos installation root folder (e.g., C1021GA)
3. Double-click 'Authentication'
4. **Enable anonymous access**
5. Repeat steps 3-4 for the image folder and its parent folder
6. (Optional) Restrict child-folders like cgi-bin if security is a concern
7. Test the report export again

**If image/directory not found:**

Place the image/directory in the specified location.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/65ff6b3e.md]")]

messages.result:
Based on the knowledge base documentation, here's the solution for your Cognos Analytics 11.0.3 image display issue:

## Problem
Images display correctly in HTML reports but appear as empty black boxes (PDF) or missing picture icons (Excel) when exporting to PDF/Excel formats.

## Common Causes
1. **Folder permissions** not configured correctly for the image directory
2. **Image not in the specified directory**
3. **Directory doesn't exist** at the specified location

## Diagnosis Steps
Use Process Monitor to identify the root cause:

1. Download Process Monitor tool (run on the same machine as Cognos)
2. Open the report in Cognos Workspace
3. Load Process Monitor
4. Press Capture/Ctrl+E to stop event capture
5. Press Clear/Ctrl+X to remove recorded entries
6. Press Capture icon to start monitoring
7. Export the report to Excel 2007/PDF
8. Save the file
9. Press Capture again to stop
10. Press Find/Ctrl+F and search for your image name
11. Check the 'Result' column to see why the image couldn't be accessed

## Resolution

**If permission issue detected:**

1. Open IIS 7.5
2. Navigate to your Cognos installation root folder (e.g., C1021GA)
3. Double-click 'Authentication'
4. **Enable anonymous access**
5. Repeat steps 3-4 for the image folder and its parent folder
6. (Optional) Restrict child-folders like cgi-bin if security is a concern
7. Test the report export again

**If image/directory not found:**

Place the image/directory in the specified location.

query: What versions of WSAS using Oracle 12c are supported? What versions of WSAS using Oracle 12c are supported?
answer:
Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found several documents mentioning WSAS (WebSphere Application Server) and Oracle 12c, but none that directly answer your specific question about which WSAS versions support Oracle 12c as a database.

The documents I found include:
- References to WSAS versions 8.0.0.x, 8.5.0.x, and 8.5.5.x in the context of Java security patches
- Information about other IBM products supporting Oracle 12c (like IBM Workload Scheduler v9.1, v9.2, v9.3, and Network Manager 4.2)
- General mentions of WSAS in WebSphere environments

However, none of these documents contain the specific compatibility matrix showing which WSAS versions support Oracle 12c as a database backend.

❌ **Unable to find specific information about WSAS versions that support Oracle 12c database in the knowledge base.**

The knowledge base contains IBM technical documentation (RAGBench techqa dataset) but doesn't appear to include the WebSphere Application Server database compatibility documentation that would answer your question. You may need to consult:
- IBM's official Software Product Compatibility Reports (SPCR)
- WebSphere Application Server detailed system requirements documentation
- IBM Support documentation specific to WSAS and Oracle 12c compatibility

docs/ragbench-techqa/19693eb8.md:13:Is it possible to use Oracle 12c with IBM Enterprise Integrator for Domino 9.0.1?
docs/ragbench-techqa/19693eb8.md:16:Yes, IBM Enterprise Integrator for Domino 9.0.1 supports Oracle 12c on platforms Windows 2008 / R2 / 2012, RHEL 6, SLES 11 and AIX 7.1 as native client and ODBC. You should install the Oracle 12c client as per Oracle documentation on the machine for using as native client. You can use Oracle 12c similarly as with earlier versions of Oracle.
docs/ragbench-techqa/2268c491.md:62:DB2 is the default topology database in Network Manager 4.2. Network Manager 4.2 also supports Oracle Database version 12c Enterprise Edition with Partitioning option.
docs/ragbench-techqa/8153d573.md:13: Based on Oracle documentation, it is always recommended to apply post-upgrade step after applying database patch. If you are using Oracle 12c or newer, it is recommended to run datapatch. If you are using Oracle 10 and 11, then you should do the @catbundle.sql psu apply.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_6ZYqt1CGQ7J68vEWaK9T8s', content='     1→---
     2→id: "edd5f9fc"
     3→title: "admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/35/doc_4"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→admin.passwd; index.html TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ Use of Installation Manager (IM) to install IBM HTTP Server (IHS webserver) starts with IHS version 8.0.0.0. Prior to use of IM, the fixpacks for IHS (V7 and V6.x) did not include files expected to be customized such as default static content files like index.html and other HTML, GIF, and ICO files installed by IHS to its <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs directory. More importantly the admin.passwd file (that holds the user/passsword for the IHS Admin Service) is usually configured right after install when using the Plugin Configration Tool (PCT).
    14→
    15→Prior to use of IM you could not install directly to a fixpack level. You had to install the base GA code (i.e. 7.0.0.0 or 6.1.0.0) and then use the Update Installer to apply fixpacks. IM supports installation directly to a fixpack level therefore all install files included with the base GA code 8.0.0.0 are applied with the fixpack. Any files that should not be overwritten must be listed in a exception list (of non-serviceable files) that the IM installer can reference. This list of non-serviceable files was ommitted or incomplete for IHS V8.0.0.0 and 8.5.0.0 so the install of the first fixpack (regardless of fixpack level) may overwrite files such as admin.passwd and index.html.
    16→
    17→There are two APAR related to the same event:
    18→.
    19→PM71612: ADDITIONAL NON-SERVICEABLE FILES ADDED FOR IBM HTTP SERVER.
    20→http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM71612]
    21→.
    22→PM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET AFTER INSTALLING
    23→FIXPACK 3 ON WAS 8.0.0.2 or 7.0.0.25 on Windows.
    24→http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM63634]
    25→
    26→.
    27→The technote about PM63634: IHS CONFIG ADMIN.PASSWD FILE WAS RESET advises a resolution in reseting the admin.passwd file:
    28→
    29→Installation of IBM HTTP Server 7.0.0.25, 8.0.0.1, 8.0.0.2, 8.0.0.3 will overlay admin.passwd:
    30→http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21593118]
    31→
    32→The main impact is that the IHS admin.passwd file gets overwritten which means the IHS Admin User/PW must be reset with the htpasswd utility in the IHS bin directory. Some customers customize the IHS splash page (index.html) or other default pages provided by IHS install so apply of first fixpack can overwrite these files and the customer's customization.
    33→
    34→The list of these non-serviceable files where included in 8.0.0.5 and 8.5.0.1 per the APAR links above so once that fixpack level is applied then any future fixpacks will not overwrite these files. There is no way to avoid the event if GA 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0 IHS is installed first. The first fixpack applied (of any fixpack) could replace the files.
    35→
    36→This Technote defines three recommendations to avoid the problem.
    37→
    38→SYMPTOM
    39→- The admin.passwd is a zero byte file after apply of fixpack
    40→
    41→ - Any content installed under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs by IHS install (default static content files) that have been customized are replaced by their default originals after apply of fixpack
    42→
    43→CAUSE
    44→Files not marked as non-serviceable files for IM install of fixpacks for IHS per APAR PM71612
    45→
    46→ENVIRONMENT
    47→WebSphere environments that use IHS v8.x to run the WSAS plugin for Webservers to act as proxy front to WSAS appservers.
    48→
    49→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    50→Support suggests one of three recommendations to avoid the problem:
    51→
    52→1. Use IM to install IHS at fixpack 8.0.0.5/8.5.0.1 or higher bypassing the install of 8.0.0.0/8.5.0.0
    53→
    54→2. Do not use PCT, configure IHS Admin or use htpasswd (or other customization/config) until after fixpack has been applied.
    55→
    56→3. If you have already installed 8.0.0.0 or 8.5.0.0 then before you apply your first IHS fixpack backup these files:
    57→
    58→- admin.passwd
    59→
    60→- all content under <IBM HTTP Server home>/htdocs
    61→
    62→
    63→
    64→PRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM
    65→ IHS

    11→
    12→SUMMARY
    13→ The IBM Emptoris Strategic Supply Management Suite, IBM Emptoris Rivermine Telecom Expense Management and IBM Emptoris Services Procurement products are affected by multiple security vulnerabilities that exist in the IBM SDK Java Technology Edition that is shipped with IBM WebSphere Application Server. The issues are disclosed in the Oracle Oct 2014 Java SE Critical Patch Update.
    14→
    15→VULNERABILITY DETAILS
    16→
    17→CVEID: CVE-2014-3566 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3566]
    18→
    19→DESCRIPTION: Product could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a design error when using the SSLv3 protocol. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack could exploit this vulnerability via a POODLE (Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption) attack to decrypt SSL sessions and access the plaintext of encrypted connections.
    20→
    21→CVSS Base Score: 4.3
    22→CVSS Temporal Score: See https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97013 [https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97013] for the current score
    23→CVSS Environmental Score*: Undefined
    24→CVSS Vector: (AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N)
    25→
    26→CVEID: CVE-2014-6457 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-6457]
    27→
    28→DESCRIPTION: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE and JRockit related to the JSSE component has partial confidentiality impact, partial integrity impact, and no availability impact.
    29→
    30→CVSS Base Score: 4

query: Is there a support's guide to the CORBA Probes? Where can I download the support's guide to the IBM CORBA probes?
answer:
Based on the documents I found, here's the answer:

---

**Yes, there is a Support's Guide to the IBM CORBA Probes.**

**Download location:**
The guide can be downloaded from IBM Support at:
**http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21614208**

The document is named `GENERIC_CORBA_SupportsGuide_20.pdf`.

**Additional context:**
- The Visibroker CORBA software was replaced by IBM CORBA integration in 2012
- New probes use the ORB provided with the IBM JRE included within the base installation of Netcool/OMNIbus
- The Support's Guide provides technical documentation that supplements the main user reference guides for CORBA integrations

**Finding other Support Guides:**
You can search for other available guides using the search text "Support's Guide [product]" in the Netcool/OMNIbus search portal.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_4Qgpww9OyMsnNQLhpexlrg', content='     1→---
     2→id: "8d10cae8"
     3→title: "visibroker; Visibroker; ORB; CORBA; corba; java orb; Java ORB; Orbix; debugging;"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/26/doc_0"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→visibroker; Visibroker; ORB; CORBA; corba; java orb; Java ORB; Orbix; debugging; dumpnameservice; nsdump; dumpns TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ IBM Java ORB : What happened to Visibroker?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→Visibroker was replaced by the IBM Java ORB in 2012
    17→
    18→ANSWER
    19→
    20→
    21→The Visibroker CORBA software is being phased out of the integrations product line. New probes will use the ORB provided with the IBM JRE included within the base installation of Netcool/OMNIbus. Ensure the probes readme or description files are read before installation to ensure that the necessary dependencies are installed first.
    22→
    23→
    24→
    25→The dumpnameservice.sh utility uses Visibroker [not Visibroker8] and Visibroker needs to be installed to use it.
    26→
    27→Its replacement is dumpns, as provided with the latest CORBA framework package [probe-corba-framework 3_0 or above]. The command is located in the $NCHOME/omnibus/probes/java/corba directory and takes the host port as arguments.
    28→
    29→You can also use the standard jacorb.jar to dump the name service contents using this syntax:
    30→java -cp /tmp/jacorb.jar org.jacorb.naming.ContextLister -url corbaloc:iiop:<naming-server-ip>:<naming-server-port>/NameService
    31→
    32→Listing output:
    33→TMF_MTNM.Class/
    34→TejasNetworks.Vendor/
    35→TejasNetworks\/NORTH-CDG.EmsInstance/
    36→3\.5.Version/
    37→TejasNetworks\/NORTH-CDG.EmsSessionFactory_I
    38→
    39→Example probe property:
    40→NamingContextPath: "TMF_MTNM.Class/TejasNetworks.Vendor/TejasNetworks\\/NORTH-CDG.EmsInstance/3\\.5.Version/TejasNetworks\\/NORTH-CDG.EmsSessionFactory_I"
    41→
    42→Note : jacorb.jar is available from the JACORB JAR download link.
    43→
    44→
    45→
    46→Debugging the Java ORB:
    47→
    48→The latest CORBA framework allows probes to use the ORB debugging properties:
    49→
    50→e.g.
    51→ORBDebug : 'true'
    52→ORBDebugFile : '/tmp/orb_debug.log'
    53→
    54→Use the -dumpprops option on the probe to see if these properties are available or not.
    55→
    56→To manually debug the IBM Java ORB the probe specific environment file needs to be modified as described below:
    57→
    58→Edit or create the $OMNIHOME/probes/java/nco_p_<probe>.env file and add the following line to enable IBM ORB trace logging.
    59→
    60→NCO_JPROBE_JAVA_FLAGS="-Dcom.ibm.CORBA.Debug=true -Dcom.ibm.CORBA.CommTrace=true -Dcom.ibm.CORBA.Debug.Output=$OMNIHOME/log/ibm_orb_trace.log $NCO_JPROBE_JAVA_FLAGS"
    61→
    62→Notes:
    63→The ORB debugging should not be enabled unless required and not left running in a production environment unless requested by IBM Tivoli Netcool support.
    64→
    65→If the property ORB debugging is available in the probe, the manual java option method does not work.
    66→
    67→If the probe reports encoding issues when used with the IBM Java ORB set the probe properties as shown below before contacting support;
    68→ORBWCharDefault : "UTF16"
    69→ORBCharEncoding : "ISO8859_1"
    70→
    71→RELATED INFORMATION
    72→#JACORB JAR download [http://www.jacorb.org/download.html]

query: TEP to TEPS communication issues with different Java versions Recent Java updates have caused connection problems when logging into the TEPS via the TEP client (Browser or Java Web Start). Is there an updated list of known issues?
answer:
Based on the knowledge base search, yes, there is documented information about TEP to TEPS communication issues with different Java versions.

## Known Issues with Java Versions

**APAR IV67716** addresses Java 8 support for the Tivoli Portal client. The document identifies several known issues:

### Java 8 Known Issues:

1. **Java 8 64-bit with Internet Explorer 11**: Fails with "This content cannot be displayed in a frame" error
   - **Workaround**: Use Java 8 32-bit with IE 11, or use the WebStart client

2. **Java 8 with Firefox**: Client does not fully initialize, showing a blank screen
   - **Workaround**: Use Internet Explorer or the WebStart client
   - Note: This was expected to be fixed in Oracle Java 8 u60 (targeted August 2015)

### Important Reference

The document specifically notes:

> "Recent Java updates have caused connection problems when logging into the portal server via the Tivoli Enterprise Portal browser and WebStart clients. Refer to technote #1672459 for important information regarding the latest Java Support requirements"

**Technote #1672459** is referenced as containing an updated list of Java support requirements and known issues.

### Fix Available

The fix for Java 8 support is included in **IBM Tivoli Monitoring 6.3.0 Fix Pack 5 (6.3.0-TIV-ITM-FP0005)**.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/2ccdb568.md > APAR IV67716]

⚠️ The document mentions technote #1672459 as the authoritative source for the latest Java support requirements, but the specific contents of that technote are not included in the knowledge base.

The need for the updated language pack 4.2.0-TIV-KIP-LP0002 with FP0008 should also be verified.\\\\n\\\\nINSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS\\\\nPlease consult the readme file 4.2.0-TIV-KIP-FP0009_readme.txt (download below via Fix Central) for detailed installation instructions.\\\\n\\\\n[http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/tivihelp/v42r1/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.ibm.itm.doc_6.2.2fp1%2Flangpack.htm] [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21290883]Refer to the \\\\\\"Recommended Maintenance\\\\\\" Technote #1290883 to locate the full list of IBM Tivoli OMEGAMON product maintenance deliverables which contain the renewed Java certificate: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21290883 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21290883]\\\\n\\\\nDOWNLOAD PACKAGE\\\\n4.2.0-TIV-KIP-FP0009.README\\\\n4.2.0-TIV-KIP-FP0009.zip\\\\n4.2.0-TIV-KIP-FP0009.tar.gz\\\\n\\\\nHOW CRITICAL IS THIS FIX?\\\\nRecommended\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEMS SOLVED\\\\nSupports security update U51 in Java V7\\\\n\\\\nKNOWN SIDE EFFECTS\\\\nNone Known\\\\n\\\\nDownload RELEASE DATE LANGUAGE SIZE(Bytes) Download Options\\\\nWhat is Fix Central(FC)? For maintenance purposes it may be necessary to install fix packs and/or interim fixes for eWAS and IHS.\\\\nYou can use this procedure to install fix packs and interim fixes for a given eWAS and IHS version, but not to upgrade to a new eWAS or IHS version. For example, you can use it to install eWAS 7.0.0.43 on top of eWAS 7.0.0.29, but you cannot use it to install eWAS version 8.0 on top of eWAS version 7.0.\\\\nThe following table shows the different levels of eWAS and IHS that are provided by 6.2.3:\\\\n\\\\nITM version eWAS version IHS version 6.23.05.00 7.0.0.29 7.0.0.00 6.23.03.00 - 6.23.04.00 7.0.0.25 7.0.0.00 6.23.01.00 - 6.23.02.00 7.0.0.19 7.0.0.00 6.23.00.00 7.0.0.15 7.0.0.00\\\\nThis technote applies specifically to eWAS, not the full version of WebSphere. Further, this technote applies only to V6.2.3 of ITM.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nFollow these steps to install a new eWAS fix pack into your ITM environment:\\\\n\\\\nStep 1. Back up your ITM environment.\\\\nBack up your ITM environment using your local procedures.\\\\n\\\\nStep 2. Download the maintenance installation scripts.\\\\nDownload the appropriate eWAS/IHS maintenance installation script to the system where your TEPS resides.\\\\nUnix/Linux: Download ewasihsv7update.sh attached below. Ensure that the script has execute permission after it has been downloaded.\\\\nls -l ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nchmod a+rx ./ewasihsv7update.sh\\\\nWindows: Download ewasihsv7update.cmd attached below.\\\\n\\\\nStep 3. Generate the list of files that need to be downloaded.\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd to generate the list of files that need to be downloaded and to create the temporary directory to hold them.\\\\nWhen the prompt beginning with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with n to exit the script so that you can download the required files.\\\\n\\\\nThe usage information for the command follows:\\\\n\\\\n * Unix:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.sh [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   If ewasihsv7update.sh was downloaded to CANDLEHOME/bin/, then the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: /tmp/ewasihsv7. You can specify a different location using the -w option.\\\\n   The -u option should only be used when installation of the UpdateInstaller to the documented default directory is not permitted.  *  AIX Default Location:\\\\n      /usr/IBM/WebSphere/UpdateInstaller Linux Default Location:\\\\n      /opt/IBM/WebSphere/UpdateInstaller\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * Windows:\\\\n   ewasihsv7update.cmd [-h candle_directory] [-w working_directory] [-u updateinstaller directory]\\\\n   -h Fully qualified path of the ITM installation directory.\\\\n   -w Fully qualified path of the temporary working directory for file downloads.\\\\n   -u Fully qualified path of the UpdateInstaller installation directory.\\\\n   The ITM installation directory default value is the %CANDLE_HOME% value retrieved from the shell environment. Normally the -h option is not needed.\\\\n   The working directory default value is: %TEMP%\\\\\\\\ewasihsv7. You can specify a different location using the -w option.\\\\n   The -u option should only be used when installation of the UpdateInstaller to the documented default directory is not permitted.  * Windows Default Location:\\\\n      \\\\\\"C:\\\\\\\\Program Files\\\\\\\\IBM\\\\\\\\WebSphere\\\\\\\\UpdateInstaller\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStep 4: Download the files listed in the output from step 3 between the two delimiter lines starting with:\\\\n<><><><><><><><><><>\\\\nThere are a number of ways to download the files:  1. If a browser is available on the TEPS system:  * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Copy and paste the full line, one at a time, into the browser address bar and then hit enter.\\\\n        * Save the file to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2. If the wget utility is available, in a command prompt on the TEPS system:  * Change directory to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n     * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Enter the wget command followed by the copy and paste of the full line, and then hit enter.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. If the ftp utility is available, in a command prompt on the TEPS system:  * Change directory to the working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n     * Run the ftp command and connect to public.dhe.ibm.com as anonymous.\\\\n     * For each file listed between the two delimiter lines in the output from step 3;  * Change the remote directory to parent directory of the file (starting with /software/websphere/appserv/support)\\\\n        * Get the file.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 4. Use any other method available to you to download the files.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nStep 5. Install the UpdateInstaller and eWAS and IHS maintenance\\\\nRun ewasihsv7update.sh or ewasihsv7update.cmd again\\\\nWhen the prompt starting with \\\\\\"Have all required files been downloaded to\\\\\\" is displayed,\\\\nrespond with y to allow the script to continue and perform the UpdateInstaller and maintenance installation actions.\\\\n\\\\nStep 6. Cleanup\\\\nRemove the temporary working directory displayed after the second delimiter line in the output from step 3.\\\\n\\\\nStep 7. Verify the update\\\\nRun run the cinfo/kincinfo command with the -i -z options, which should print out the following messages:\\\\n\\\\nOn a UNIX/Linux system,\\\\nwhere $CANDLEHOME is the IBM Tivoli
