[TextBlock(text='Based on the knowledge base search, yes, there is documented information about TEP to TEPS communication issues with different Java versions.

## Known Issues with Java Versions

**APAR IV67716** addresses Java 8 support for the Tivoli Portal client. The document identifies several known issues:

### Java 8 Known Issues:

1. **Java 8 64-bit with Internet Explorer 11**: Fails with "This content cannot be displayed in a frame" error
   - **Workaround**: Use Java 8 32-bit with IE 11, or use the WebStart client

2. **Java 8 with Firefox**: Client does not fully initialize, showing a blank screen
   - **Workaround**: Use Internet Explorer or the WebStart client
   - Note: This was expected to be fixed in Oracle Java 8 u60 (targeted August 2015)

### Important Reference

The document specifically notes:

> "Recent Java updates have caused connection problems when logging into the portal server via the Tivoli Enterprise Portal browser and WebStart clients. Refer to technote #1672459 for important information regarding the latest Java Support requirements"

**Technote #1672459** is referenced as containing an updated list of Java support requirements and known issues.

### Fix Available

The fix for Java 8 support is included in **IBM Tivoli Monitoring 6.3.0 Fix Pack 5 (6.3.0-TIV-ITM-FP0005)**.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/2ccdb568.md > APAR IV67716]

⚠️ The document mentions technote #1672459 as the authoritative source for the latest Java support requirements, but the specific contents of that technote are not included in the knowledge base.')]

query: How can I configure J2EE Tomcat DC to run as Windows Service? I'm trying to configure ITCAM J2EE v7.1.1 Tomcat DC to run as a Windows Service but it fails. Is this type of configuration supported? If so, what is the right procedure to do that?
answer:
Based on my search of the knowledge base, I found documents related to ITCAM for J2EE and Tomcat monitoring, but none of them contain specific information about configuring the Tomcat DC to run as a Windows Service.

The available documentation covers:
- How to download, install, and start Apache Tomcat server on Windows (using startup.bat/shutdown.bat scripts)
- How to configure and monitor Tomcat with ITCAM for J2EE v7.1.1.x
- Various troubleshooting scenarios for ITCAM J2EE Data Collectors

⚠️ **The documents mention installing and configuring ITCAM for J2EE v7.1.1.x with Tomcat, but do not provide specific procedures for running the Tomcat DC as a Windows Service, nor do they explicitly state whether this configuration is supported.**

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/92f09282.md]

**Recommendation**: For definitive information about whether ITCAM J2EE v7.1.1 Tomcat DC supports Windows Service configuration and the proper procedure, you should:
1. Consult the official ITCAM for J2EE v7.1.1 installation and configuration guide
2. Contact IBM support for clarification on this specific configuration scenario
3. Check the product documentation for any Windows Service-specific installation options or limitations

❌ The knowledge base does not contain documentation that answers your specific question about Windows Service configuration for the Tomcat DC.

(TROUBLESHOOTING)\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM(ABSTRACT)\\\\n When multiple instances of SAP NetWeaver are installed on a single operating system instance, configuration of the Data Collector for one or several NetWeaver instances fails.\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nYou need to set permissions for the Data Collector installation directory.\\\\n\\\\nDIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM\\\\nThe following messages might be present in the configuration log file:\\\\n\\\\nUser that runs NetWeaver application server can not access the ITCAM DC home directory, or the user is not the member of the user group of ITCAM DC.\\\\n\\\\nRESOLVING THE PROBLEM\\\\nThe admin users for every SAP NetWeaver instance must belong to the same group (for example, sapsys).\\\\n\\\\nWhen installing the Data Collector, run the installation program as a user belonging to the same group. Alternatively, change the group of the Data Collector installation tree (DC_home) to this group, for example:\\\\n\\\\nchgrp -R sapsys /opt/IBM/itcam/J2EE/DC\\\\n\\\\nFor all files and directories in the tree, the group must have at least the same permissions as the owner. To achieve this in the simplest way, grant the group read, write, and execute permissions for all files in the tree, for example:\\\\n\\\\nchown -R g+rwx /opt/IBM/itcam/J2EE/DC\\\\n\\\\nAlso, make sure that the group has read and write permissions for the Tivoli logging directory (by default, /var/ibm/tivoli/common),\\\\n\\\\nTo configure each SAP NetWeaver instance that you need to monitor, run the Data Collector configuration tool using the admin user for the instance.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Systems and Asset Management Tivoli Composite Application Manager for J2EE ITCAM J2EE NETWEAVER Solaris, AIX, HP-UX, Linux 6.1\\"\\n  },\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": -3.0455,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"92f09282\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"92f09282-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/92f09282.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"CAMADALL Tomcat Apache download install start up monitor tema TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"CAMADALL Tomcat Apache download install start up monitor tema TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nTHIS DOCUMENT APPLIES ONLY TO THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGE VERSION(S):\\\\n US English\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n Downloading and installing the Tomcat Apache server in preparation for ITCAM monitoring.\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nSo you want to download, install and monitor the Apache Tomcat server on your Windows system but don\'t quite know where to start?\\\\n\\\\nWell, start here...\\\\n\\\\nA. Add JNDI resource information to the web application environment file <TOMCAT_HOME>/conf/web.xml.\\\\n\\\\n........\\\\n\\\\n<resource-ref>\\\\n<res-ref-name>jdbc/sample</res-ref-name>\\\\n<res-type>javax.sql.DataSource</res-type>\\\\n<res-auth>Container</res-auth>\\\\n</resource-ref>\\\\n\\\\n</web-app>\\\\n\\\\n3. Add JNDI data source information to tomcat configuration file <TOMCAT_HOME>/conf/context.xml\\\\n\\\\ntomcat@db2ps1:~/tomcat7054/conf> cat context.xml\\\\n<?xml version=\'1.0\' encoding=\'utf-8\'?>\\\\n<Context>\\\\n<WatchedResource>WEB-INF/web.xml</WatchedResource>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n<Resource auth=\\\\\\"Container\\\\\\"\\\\ndriverClassName=\\\\\\"com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver\\\\\\"\\\\nname=\\\\\\"jdbc/sample\\\\\\"\\\\npassword=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\nusername=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\ntype=\\\\\\"javax.sql.DataSource\\\\\\"\\\\nurl=\\\\\\"jdbc:db2://db2ps3.au.ibm.com:61118/sample\\\\\\"\\\\nenableClientAffinitiesList=\\\\\\"1\\\\\\"\\\\nretryIntervalForClientReroute=\\\\\\"2\\\\\\"\\\\naffinityFailbackInterval=\\\\\\"300\\\\\\"\\\\nuser=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\nenableSeamlessFailover=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nclientRerouteAlternateServerName=\\\\\\"db2ps3.au.ibm.com,db2ps2.au.ibm.com\\\\\\"\\\\ndatabaseName=\\\\\\"sample\\\\\\"\\\\nmaxRetriesForClientReroute=\\\\\\"3\\\\\\"\\\\nclientRerouteAlternatePortNumber=\\\\\\"61118,61118\\\\\\"\\\\ndriverType=\\\\\\"4\\\\\\"\\\\ncurrentSchema=\\\\\\"psinst2\\\\\\"\\\\nremoveAbandoned=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\nremoveAbandonedTimeout=\\\\\\"60\\\\\\"\\\\nlogAbandoned=\\\\\\"true\\\\\\"\\\\n/>\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n</Context>\\\\n4. Sample application code to get connection from the datasource name.\\\\n\\\\n.....\\\\nConnection conn = null;\\\\nStatement stmt = null;\\\\nResultSet rs = null;\\\\ntry {\\\\nContext c = new InitialContext();\\\\nDataSource ds =(DataSource)c.lookup(\\\\\\"java:comp/env/jdbc/sample\\\\\\");\\\\nconn = ds.getConnection();\\\\n......\\\\n5. During client affinity test, following message will be recorded in the Tomcat log file <TOMCAT_HOME>/logs/catalina.out\\\\n\\\\ncom.ibm.db2.jcc.am.ClientRerouteException:\\\\n[jcc][t4][2027][11212][3.63.123] A connection failed but has been\\\\nre-established. The host name or IP address is \\\\\\"db2ps2.au.ibm.com\\\\\\" and\\\\nthe service name or port number is 61,118. query:
Traffic across domains seems unexpected 

I have two Multi-Protocol Gateways (MPGWs) configured, each in their own domain:

     Domain A
     MPGW_A
     FSH_A (1.2.3.4:443)
     Domain B
     MPGW_B
     FSH_B (0.0.0.0:443)

The FSH_B is disabled, thus MPGW_B cannot take traffic. However, if I modify the config for MPGW_B (i.e. just change a Stylesheet parameter) the traffic goes to MPGW_B somehow. How is this happening? FSH_B is still disabled.
answer:
Based on my search of the knowledge base, I found several documents about IBM DataPower Multi-Protocol Gateways (MPGWs), but none of them directly address the specific issue you're describing about traffic routing across domains when FSH is disabled.

The documents I found discuss:
- MPGW configuration with HTTP proxy policies and SSL tunneling [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/6b083006.md]
- MPGW with SFTP Server Front Side Handler issues [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/ace9a0e8.md]
- MQ Front Side Handler (FSH) configuration with queue managers [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/ba7b5156.md]
- MPGW persistent connection and retry behavior [来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/2c3acf8d.md]

However, none of these documents explain the specific behavior where:
- FSH_B is disabled in Domain B
- Modifying MPGW_B configuration causes traffic to route to it despite FSH_B being disabled
- Cross-domain traffic routing when FSH uses 0.0.0.0:443 vs specific IP

⚠️ The knowledge base contains general information about MPGW and FSH configuration, but does not provide specific troubleshooting steps or explanations for unexpected cross-domain traffic routing when a Front Side Handler is disabled. 

For this specific DataPower configuration issue, you may need to:
- Check DataPower logs for routing decisions
- Verify domain isolation settings
- Review if there are any shared objects or policies between domains
- Consult IBM DataPower official documentation or support for cross-domain traffic behavior

    34→ERROR DESCRIPTION
    35→ *  Affected are customers sending HTTP GET requests to the
    36→   multiprotocol gateway, web service proxy or web application
    37→   firewall service.
    38→
    39→   With the present implementation, users may end up in a state
    40→   with indefinite retries for HTTP GET requests as long as
    41→   DataPower has at least one live persistent connection to the
    42→   backend server. After timeout interval for active connection it
    43→   will terminate the connection and retry using remaining
    44→   persistent connections to the backend. (If a new connection is
    45→   opened because of half-dead backend this can continue
    46→   indefinitely or until the request is served).
    47→
    48→
    49→
    50→
    51→
    52→
    53→LOCAL FIX
    54→ *  This behavior cannot be turned off however it can be mitigated.
    55→   For some relief out of this, the admin can lower the Back
    56→   Persistent Timeout and/or User Agent's default Timeout. This
    57→   should result in less persistent connections to the backend and
    58→   thus less possible timeout hops
    59→
    60→   Dropping the backend persistent connections option is also a
    61→   possible workaround, but the consequences should be weighed
    62→   carefully before making this decision. Not using persistent
    63→   connections comes with a performance penalty, but it very much
    64→   depends on the size/type of the transferred data and the
    65→   speed/ping of the network.
    66→
    67→   SLM is also strongly encouraged to prevent the backend from
    68→   getting more load than it can handle.
    69→
    70→
    71→
    72→
    73→
    74→
    75→PROBLEM SUMMARY
    76→ *  Affected are all customers using the Multi-Protocol Gateway,
    77→   Web Service Proxy or Web Application Firewall with persistent
    78→   connection to the backend side.
    79→
    80→   In case the backend server stops responding to HTTP GET
    81→   requests while there are already some established TCP
    82→   connections from the time the server worked OK, DataPower will
    83→   automatically retry those GET requests after a timeout period.
    84→   This will be retried until there are no established connections
    85→   to the server.
    86→
    87→   During a high load window, these unwanted retries might
    88→   eventually keep flooding an already congested backend,
    89→   especially if it is still able to establish some new
    90→   connections.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_Z79PLsIyZD7XUkBpd7GmE1', content='     1→---
     2→id: "6b083006"
     3→title: "Forward Proxy XMLFW MPGW CONNECT TUNNEL TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/48/doc_4"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→Forward Proxy XMLFW MPGW CONNECT TUNNEL TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ How to configure an IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance Service to proxy an SSL request to a remote proxy server using the CONNECT method for SSL tunneling?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→Many common forward proxy servers expect requests in different formats depending on if they are proxying non-SSL or SSL requests.
    17→
    18→For example, a non-SSL request to be proxied may come in the form of GET hostname:port/URI.
    19→
    20→For SSL requests to be proxied, remote proxy servers are commonly configured to tunnel the request from the client to the backend server.
    21→
    22→In the SSL request scenario, remote proxy servers will typically expect a CONNECT request and then tunnel the SSL request from the client to the backend server.
    23→
    24→Users configuring DataPower may need a way to implement this CONNECT method for SSL tunneling to a remote Proxy Server.
    25→
    26→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    27→Non-SSL Proxy requests will work using either:
    28→
    29→a) an XML Firewall when configuring in the HTTP Options tab, where the user can configure the Proxy Host and Port
    30→
    31→b) a Multi-Protocol Gateway when configuring an HTTP Proxy Policy in the User Agent
    32→
    33→SSL Proxy requests will work using the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling when using a Multi-Protocol Gateway when configuring in a User Agent's HTTP Proxy Policy.
    34→
    35→The XML Firewall service is not designed to use the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_a0rXbR1X7134QeaMhNEf4b', content='     1→---
     2→id: "ba7b5156"
     3→title: "TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/10/doc_1"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ When to enable Sharing Conversations in DataPower MQ Queue Manager (mq-qm) object along with SHARECNV attribute of the MQ SVRCONN channel?
    14→
    15→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    16→IBM WebSphere MQ server version 7.0 and later releases provide sharing conversations (SHARECNV) attribute on SVRCONN channel that specifies the maximum number of conversations that can share each TCP/IP channel instance. This feature can be configured in DataPower as it uses client connection with queue manager SVRCONN channel.
    17→The default setting of sharing conversations (SHARECNV) value is zero in DataPower mq-qm object. The same default value for MQ SVRCONN channel is 10. The sharing conversations value is
    18→negotiated between MQ server and DataPower and the lower value takes effect. However, in current versions of the DataPower firmware, the sharing conversations setting of 1 is treated as 0 when negotiating with MQ server.
    19→
    20→There are three use cases to configure Sharing Conversations in DataPower mq-qm object:
    21→
    22→Case #1 : The negotiated sharing conversations value is 0 - The channel runs in a mode similar to WebSphere MQ V6 and does not uses features such as
    23→
    24→· Administrator stop-quiesce
    25→· Heartbeating
    26→· Read ahead
    27→· Client asynchronous consume
    28→
    29→Set a value of 0 or 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq-qm object in DataPower to disable sharing conversations regardless of the IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting.
    30→
    31→Case #2: The negotiated sharing conversations value is 1 - The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ V7 and later release features as outlined in case #1, but each TCP/IP channel instance has a single conversation.
    32→
    33→Set a value of 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute and select "on" in Share Single Conversation attribute of the mq-qm object in DataPower as shown in the following picture and a value of 1 on IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting.
    34→
    35→The Share Single Conversation attribute is only visible when "Sharing Conversations" is configured with value of "1" and then <RETURN> key is entered. For values greater than 1, the "Share Single Conversation" attribute is hidden in the mq-qm object.
    36→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21647231&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21647231&aid=1]
    37→
    38→Case #3: The negotiated sharing conversations value is 2 or more - The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ 7 and later release features and each TCP/IP channel instance supports 2 or more conversations.
    39→
    40→Set a value of 2 or more on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq-qm object in DataPower and on the MQ SVRCONN channel.
    41→
    42→On average, processing of messages from client applications is 15 percent slower when using SHARECNV(10) as compared to SHARECNV(0). Please refer to Performance Implications of Sharing [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_7.0.1/com.ibm.mq.csqzaf.doc/mi12240_.htm]
    43→Conversations on Client-connection Channels. [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_7.0.1/com.ibm.mq.csqzaf.doc/mi12240_.htm].
    44→
    45→Since DataPower uses a connection pool in processing MQ messages, there are no additional benefits of using sharing conversations with the mq-qm object. However, in situations when mixed message sizes are used by the same mq-qm object, using case #2 will benefit mq-qm object as it will use new buffer management feature of IBM WebSphere MQ Version 7 when making MQGET API call.
    46→
    47→When using a negotiated shared conversations value of 0 as in case #1, mq-qm object uses maximum message size as the buffer pool for the MQGET API call. However, when mixed message sizes are processed by the same MQ Front Side Handler (FSH), it requests buffer pool based on maximum message size configured in the mq-qm object. The use of fixed buffer pool for small and large messages can deplete MQ server's allocated buffer and contribute to unexpected termination of MQ SVRCONN channel instance and may terminate the queue manager. In such a situation, using a negotiated sharing conversations value of 1 as in case #2 will benefit DataPower mq-qm object as it will use IBM WebSphere MQ Version 7 Read Ahead feature and the new buffer management feature for MQGET API call. IBM WebSphere MQ V8 release provides enhanced performance for case #2, when the negotiated sharing conversations value is 1.
    48→
    49→For DataPower firmware releases 7.0.0.x, 7.1.0.x, 7.2.0.x and earlier, one should follow case #1 and use a negotiated sharing conversations value of 0. If you configure these firmware versions with case #2 or case #3, DataPower device may reload or hang due to connection instability and generate many MQ errors with Reason Code - 2009 and 2059.
    50→
    51→Cases #2 and #3 can be used in firmware releases 7.5.0.x, 7.5.1.x and later. We suggest to use a value of 10 or less in Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq-qm object and verify the configuration empirically to make sure that IBM WebSphere MQ server can sustain load from DataPower with the negotiated Sharing Conversations of 10.
    52→
    53→Note: In order to use sharing conversations, make sure you have applied APAR IV24821 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1IV24821] ("Client C application process hangs after cancelling thread") to the IBM WebSphere MQ server. IV24821 is included in IBM WebSphere MQ V7.0.1.10 and later, IBM WebSphere MQ V7.1.0.3 and later, IBM WebSphere MQ V7.5.0.1 and later, and IBM WebSphere MQ V8.
    54→
    55→In order to identify the negotiated Sharing Conversations status, the following MQ commands are used in the distributed platform.
    56→
    57→runmqsc <qmgr>
    58→display chs(CHANNEL3) maxshcnv curshcnv
    59→
    60→display chs(CHANNEL3) maxshcnv curshcnv
    61→1 : display chs(CHANNEL3) maxshcnv curshcnv
    62→AMQ8417: Display Channel Status details.
    63→CHANNEL(CHANNEL3) CHLTYPE(SVRCONN)
    64→CONNAME(9.x1.x2.x3) CURRENT
    65→STATUS(RUNNING) SUBSTATE(RECEIVE)
    66→CURSHCNV(1) MAXSHCNV(1) <---- Negotiated Sharing Conversations value of 1
    67→AMQ8417: Display Channel Status details.
    68→CHANNEL(CHANNEL3) CHLTYPE(SVRCONN)
    69→CONNAME(9.y1.y2.y31) CURRENT
    70→STATUS(RUNNING) SUBSTATE(RECEIVE)
    71→CURSHCNV(0) MAXSHCNV(0) <---- Negotiated Sharing Conversations value of 0
    72→
    73→end
    74→--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    75→In order to identify the negotiated Sharing Conversations status, the following MQ commands are used in the z/OS System.
    76→
    77→connect to <qmgr>
    78→On z/OS system, options for issuing the commands are described at http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_8.0.0/com.ibm.mq.ref.adm.doc/q085120_.htm [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSFKSJ_8.0.0/com.ibm.mq.ref.adm.doc/q085120_.htm].
    79→/+RTP8 DIS CHSTATUS(channel_name) MAXSHCNV CURSHCNV
    80→where "+RTP8" is the command prefix.

- Consult IBM DataPower official documentation or support for cross-domain traffic behavior

query:
Executing a scenario suite with a Scenario Service Provider (SSP) over HTTPS How to configure the machines hosting the WebSphere Operational Decision Management modules with regard to HTTPS when executing scenario suites ?
How to avoid the exception below while requesting from Decision Center the execution of a scenario suite on Scenario Service Provider (SSP) over HTTPS ?
 Exception caught while contacting RES ilog.rules.res.util.http.IlrConnectionException: IO error when contacting "/res/repositoryService"
 ....
 Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: com.ibm.jsse2.util.g: PKIX path building failed: java.security.cert.CertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
answer:
Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found relevant documents about the SSL certificate error you're encountering, but I did not find a specific document titled "Executing a scenario suite with a Scenario Service Provider (SSP) over HTTPS."

However, I found several IBM technical documents that address the exact `SSLHandshakeException: PKIX path building failed` error in WebSphere environments. Here's what the knowledge base contains:

## Root Cause

The error occurs because the Java truststore doesn't contain the SSL certificate of the target server (Scenario Service Provider). When Decision Center tries to connect to SSP over HTTPS, the SSL handshake fails due to missing certificate validation.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/da985963.md]

## Related Issues Found

**1. WebSphere Liberty Profile Collective Members (APAR PI05059)**
- Same `PKIX path building failed` error when running applications in a collective
- Problem: Code was setting SSLSocketFactory for entire JVM incorrectly
- Solution: Instance-based setting of SSL Socket factory on JMXConnector
- Fixed in WebSphere Application Server V8.5.5 Fix Pack 2+

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/da985963.md]

**2. WebSphere DataPower XC10 Appliance (APAR IC91195)**
- Same SSL certificate path error during appliance assimilation
- Problem: StartHandler process didn't set system SSL properties early enough
- Solution: Corrected to set SSL properties early in processing

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/6f2c6c6e.md]

**3. IBM SmartCloud Orchestrator (CWLLG0594E)**
- Similar error when clicking offerings in Self-service tab
- Resolution steps provided:
  1. Restart IBM Business Process Manager from admin console
  2. Stop Deployment Manager: `/opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/stopManager.sh`
  3. Restart Deployment Manager: `/opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/startManager.sh`

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/1c8d31f0.md]

⚠️ **The knowledge base contains information about the SSL certificate error pattern and fixes for related WebSphere products, but does not provide specific configuration steps for Decision Center + Scenario Service Provider HTTPS setup (such as importing certificates into truststore, configuring SSL in Decision Center, or SSP-specific HTTPS configuration).**

For the complete solution to your specific scenario, you'll need to refer to the official IBM Operational Decision Manager documentation on configuring SSL/TLS between Decision Center and Scenario Service Provider.

    10→CWLLG0594E; PKIX; GenericREST; com.ibm.orchestrator.restcall.GenericREST TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ A "PKIX path building failed" message is seen in the IBM SmartCloud Orchestrator user interface when you click an offering on the Self-service tab.
    14→
    15→SYMPTOM
    16→The following exception is received:
    17→
    18→[2/10/14 19:15:16:814 CST] 00000111 wle E CWLLG0594E: An exception occurred while initializing the runnable thread. Error:com.lombardisoftware.component.common.workflow.WorkflowProcessItemException: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: com.ibm.jsse2.util.j: PKIX path building failed:java.security.cert.CertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target in
    19→com.ibm.orchestrator.restcall.GenericREST
    20→
    21→at com.lombardisoftware.component.common.workflow.ExecutionJob.doJob(ExecutionJob.java:421)
    22→at com.lombardisoftware.server.ejb.workflow.EJBWorkflowManagerBean.doResumeWorkflowEngine(EJBWorkflowManagerBean.java:1287)
    23→at com.lombardisoftware.server.ejb.workflow.EJBWorkflowManagerBean.resumeProcess(EJBWorkflowManagerBean.java:407)
    24→at com.lombardisoftware.server.ejb.workflow.EJSRemoteStatefulEJBWorkflowManager_82478d70.resumeProcess(Unknown Source)
    25→at com.lombardisoftware.server.ejb.workflow._EJBWorkflowManagerInterface_St
    26→ub.resumeProcess(_EJBWorkflowManagerInterface_Stub.java:518)
    27→at com.lombardisoftware.component.common.workflow.EJBWorkflowManagerDelegat

    29→at com.lombardisoftware.component.common.workflow.EJBWorkflowManagerDelegat
    30→eWebSphere$6.run(EJBWorkflowManagerDelegateWebSphere.java:84)
    31→at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(AccessController.java:280)
    32→
    33→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    34→To resolve the problem, complete the following steps:
    35→
    36→ 1. Restart IBM Business Process Manager from the administrative console. To restart it, click Servers > All servers > SingleClusterServer1.

    39→ 2. Stop the Deployment Manager by running the /opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/stopManager.sh command.

    44→You can access the Administrative Console for IBM Business Process Manager using the following URL syntax: https://<Central Server 4>:9043/ibm/console

    34→ *  Fail to login to an application with exception:]
    35→   javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: com.ibm.jsse2.util.j:
    36→   PKIX path building failed:
    37→   java.security.cert.CertPathBuilderException: unable to find
    38→   valid certification path to requested target.
    39→
    40→   The application relies on the fact that the Liberty profile
    41→   server sets a SSLContext created with the default SSL
    42→   configuration as the process's default.  When running in just
    43→   a Liberty Profile server all is okay.  When they run in a
    44→   collective a cert path error is hit.  This happens because the
    45→   default SSL Configuration is being used when the app make it's
    46→   httpsURLConnection call.
    47→
    48→
    49→
    50→
    51→
    52→
    53→LOCAL FIX
    54→
    55→PROBLEM SUMMARY
    56→ *  ****************************************************************
    57→   * USERS AFFECTED:  All users of IBM WebSphere Application      *
    58→   *                  Server Liberty Profile version 8.5.5        *
    59→   *                  Collective Members.                         *
    60→   ****************************************************************
    61→   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: Fail to login to an application with    *
    62→   *                      SSLHandshakeException on a              *
    63→   *                      server with collectiveMember-1.0        *
    64→   *                      feature.                                *
    65→   ****************************************************************
    66→   * RECOMMENDATION:                                              *
    67→   ****************************************************************
    68→   This problem was caused because the code setting the
    69→   SSLSocketFactory for the entire JVM which resulted in
    70→   failure to login to an application with the following
    71→   exception:
    72→   javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: com.ibm.jsse2.util.j:
    73→   PKIX path building failed:
    74→   java.security.cert.CertPathBuilderException: unable to find
    75→   valid certification path to requested target.
    76→   This can also be caused by application code doing the same
    77→   thing.
    78→
    79→
    80→
    81→
    82→

    85→ *  We now have instance base setting of the SSL Socket factory on
    86→   the JMXConnector.
    87→   The fix for this APAR is currently targeted for inclusion in
    88→   fix pack 8.5.5.2. Please refer to the Recommended Updates

    32→   service is synced to decision center. This rule project has to

    35→   If you disconnect the rule project after publish it to DC (keep
    36→   connection entries), there will be various errors afterwards in
    37→   Decision Center while extracting project state, and pulling the
    38→   projects from DC into a new workspace.
    39→   To reproduce with loan validation service sample:

    12→ABSTRACT
    13→ This cumulative fix pack updates Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1 to V8.5.1.1.
    14→
    15→DOWNLOAD DESCRIPTION
    16→This fix pack is entitled. Only customers who have purchased Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1 can use this fix pack.
    17→
    18→How to install the fix pack
    19→If you are not installing both components, skip the instructions regarding Decision Center or Decision Server.
    20→
    21→ 1. For Decision Center, download 8.5.1-WS-ODM_DC-<OS>-FP001.zip, and extract its files. (Change <OS> to match your platform: AIX, HPUX, LINUX, OS400, SOLARIS, ZOS, or WIN32.)
    22→ 2. Extract the archive to a new folder, named WDC.
    23→ 3. For Decision Server, Download 8.5.1-WS-ODM_DS-<OS>-FP001.zip, and extract its files. (Change <OS> to match your platform: AIX, HPUX, LINUX, OS400, SOLARIS, ZOS, or WIN32.)
    24→ 4. Extract the archive to a new folder, named WDS.
    25→
    26→Installing by using IBM Installation Manager:  1. Launch IBM Installation Manager.
    27→ 2. In the toolbar menu, open File > Preferences and do the following:
    28→ 3. Select repositories.  1. For Decision Center, click Add Repository.
    29→     2. Browse to the extracted folder WDC\updates.
    30→     3. Select the file repository.config.
    31→     4. For Decision Server, click Add Repository.
    32→     5. Browse to the extracted folder WDS\updates.
    33→     6. Select the file repository.config.
    34→     7. Make sure the repositories are selected in the Repositories list.
    35→
    36→
    37→ 4. Click Apply to save your changes, and click OK to close the Repositories list.
    38→ 5. Click Update to update your installation.
    39→ 6. Follow the instructions in the installation manager to complete the installation.
    40→
    41→Installing by using the Installation Manager command line:  1. Locate the imcl command under <IM installation>/eclipse/tools.
    42→ 2. Run the commandimcl updateAll -repositories WDC/updates,WDS/updates -acceptLicense.
    43→
    44→ * Use the option -installDirectory <install path of ODM 8.5.1> to update a specific installation.
    45→ * If you update only Decision Server or Decision Center, specify the repository accordingly.
    46→
    47→Applying the fix pack
    48→After you install the fix pack, you might have to do additional steps to apply the fix pack in your environment. To complete the update, see When and how to apply a modification or fix pack [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665766].
    49→
    50→Warning:
    51→If you have installed interim fixes for Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1, you must uninstall the fixes before you can install this fix pack. You must also stop the Operational Decision Manager sample server for this installation. If you do not uninstall the fixes and stop the server, the installation of the fix pack will fail. If you attempt to install the fix pack without uninstalling the interim fixes, the installer will uninstall the interim fixes before it fails.     12→QUESTION
    13→ How do I increase the heap size of the JVM used to run Decision Validation Services (DVS) tests in Rule Studio?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→When running DVS tests from Rule Studio against a local Scenario Service Provider (SSP) service, the environment is subject to the memory limitations of the running Eclipse JVM.
    17→
    18→You may encounter the following error:
    19→
    20→ilog.rules.dvs.util.IlrDVSLogger error
    21→SEVERE: scenario provider or scenario execution threw exception !
    22→adding an error to the report java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
    23→
    24→ANSWER
    25→Use Java options, -Xms (initial heap size) and -Xmx (maximum heap size), to increase the heap size of the JVM used to launch the DVS test.
    26→
    27→As you will be changing the default heap configuration of the JVM, we recommend that you designate a separate JRE for the DVS tests to avoid modifying the workspace default JVM options, which may impact other run configurations.
    28→
    29→Follow the steps below:
    30→
    31→ 1. In the DVS run configuration, under the JRE tab, select Alternate JRE. Click Installed JREs
    32→    [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=1]
    33→
    34→ 2. Select a jdk of your choice and click Duplicate
    35→    [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=2] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=2]
    36→
    37→
    38→ 3. Set Default VM arguments: use Java options, -Xms and -Xmx, to tune the JVM heap size. Name the new JRE. Click Finish.
    39→    [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=3] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=3]
    40→
    41→
    42→ 4. Click OK in the Preferences window.
    43→ 5.  In the Run Configuration window, select the newly added JRE. Click Apply and Run.
    44→    [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=4] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21427125&aid=4]
    45→

    13→ How to generate Common Event Infrastructure events from the rule executions ?

    16→ANSWER
    17→The decision trace captured for JRules Decision Warehouse (DW) can be customized so that Common Event Infrastructure (CEI) events are emitted whenever a ruleset, a task or a rule is executed. Based on the rule execution CEI event format, a business rule monitoring model can be defined with the WebSphere Business Monitor Development Toolkit 7.0 in WebSphere Integration Developer 7.0.
    18→A dashboard can then present the information in Business Space., with graphs such as:
    19→
    20→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21440000&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21440000&aid=1]

    22→Instructions to generate CEI events from rule execution events:
    23→jrules-ceitrace.zip [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21440000&aid=3] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21440000&aid=2]
    24→
    25→ 1. Unzip the attached sample jrules-ceitrace.zip to a local folder
    26→ 2. Edit the file jrules-ceitrace/build.xml and modify properties to reflect your environment : jrules.home should point to the base folder of your JRules installation and wps.home to WebSphere Process Server ( or corresponding WebSphere Integration Developer test environment )
    27→ 3. By default this sample generates CEI events without saving the decision trace in DW. If you want to have both DW persistence and CEI events emitted, replace the content of the file jrules-ceitrace/src/dvs-dw.properties with the file jrules-ceitrace/src/dvs-dw-both-dw-and-cei.properties
    28→ 4. From a command line execute : ant build
    29→ 5. Bundle the library jrules-ceitrace/build/jrules-ceitrace.jar with the application executing rules:  * If you are using JRules Hosted Transparent Decision Service (HTDS), in jrules-res-htds-<appserver>.ear/jrules-res-htds-<appserver>.war/WEB-INF/lib
    30→     * If you are using JRules Scenario Service Provider (SSP) in jrules-ssp-<appserver>.ear/jrules-ssp-server.war/WEB-INF/lib
    31→     * If you are executing rules from your application, the sample should be packaged alongside the RES session library that your application already bundles
    32→
    33→
    34→ 6. On the ruleset(s) that you wish to monitor set the properties:  * monitoring.enabled =true
    35→     * ruleset.trace.sequential.enabled = true (if you are using sequential rule tasks)

    37→

[TextBlock(text='Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found relevant documents about the SSL certificate error you're encountering, but I did not find a specific document titled "Executing a scenario suite with a Scenario Service Provider (SSP) over HTTPS."

However, I found several IBM technical documents that address the exact `SSLHandshakeException: PKIX path building failed` error in WebSphere environments. Here's what the knowledge base contains:

## Root Cause

The error occurs because the Java truststore doesn't contain the SSL certificate of the target server (Scenario Service Provider). When Decision Center tries to connect to SSP over HTTPS, the SSL handshake fails due to missing certificate validation.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/da985963.md]

## Related Issues Found

**1. WebSphere Liberty Profile Collective Members (APAR PI05059)**
- Same `PKIX path building failed` error when running applications in a collective
- Problem: Code was setting SSLSocketFactory for entire JVM incorrectly
- Solution: Instance-based setting of SSL Socket factory on JMXConnector
- Fixed in WebSphere Application Server V8.5.5 Fix Pack 2+

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/da985963.md]

**2. WebSphere DataPower XC10 Appliance (APAR IC91195)**
- Same SSL certificate path error during appliance assimilation
- Problem: StartHandler process didn't set system SSL properties early enough
- Solution: Corrected to set SSL properties early in processing

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/6f2c6c6e.md]

**3. IBM SmartCloud Orchestrator (CWLLG0594E)**
- Similar error when clicking offerings in Self-service tab
- Resolution steps provided:
  1. Restart IBM Business Process Manager from admin console
  2. Stop Deployment Manager: `/opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/stopManager.sh`
  3. Restart Deployment Manager: `/opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/startManager.sh`

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/1c8d31f0.md]

⚠️ **The knowledge base contains information about the SSL certificate error pattern and fixes for related WebSphere products, but does not provide specific configuration steps for Decision Center + Scenario Service Provider HTTPS setup (such as importing certificates into truststore, configuring SSL in Decision Center, or SSP-specific HTTPS configuration).**

For the complete solution to your specific scenario, you'll need to refer to the official IBM Operational Decision Manager documentation on configuring SSL/TLS between Decision Center and Scenario Service Provider.')]

messages.result:
Based on my search through the knowledge base, I found relevant documents about the SSL certificate error you're encountering, but I did not find a specific document titled "Executing a scenario suite with a Scenario Service Provider (SSP) over HTTPS."

However, I found several IBM technical documents that address the exact `SSLHandshakeException: PKIX path building failed` error in WebSphere environments. Here's what the knowledge base contains:

## Root Cause

The error occurs because the Java truststore doesn't contain the SSL certificate of the target server (Scenario Service Provider). When Decision Center tries to connect to SSP over HTTPS, the SSL handshake fails due to missing certificate validation.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/da985963.md]

## Related Issues Found

**1. WebSphere Liberty Profile Collective Members (APAR PI05059)**
- Same `PKIX path building failed` error when running applications in a collective
- Problem: Code was setting SSLSocketFactory for entire JVM incorrectly
- Solution: Instance-based setting of SSL Socket factory on JMXConnector
- Fixed in WebSphere Application Server V8.5.5 Fix Pack 2+

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/da985963.md]

**2. WebSphere DataPower XC10 Appliance (APAR IC91195)**
- Same SSL certificate path error during appliance assimilation
- Problem: StartHandler process didn't set system SSL properties early enough
- Solution: Corrected to set SSL properties early in processing

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/6f2c6c6e.md]

**3. IBM SmartCloud Orchestrator (CWLLG0594E)**
- Similar error when clicking offerings in Self-service tab
- Resolution steps provided:
  1. Restart IBM Business Process Manager from admin console
  2. Stop Deployment Manager: `/opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/stopManager.sh`
  3. Restart Deployment Manager: `/opt/ibm/BPM/v8.5/profiles/DmgrProfile/bin/startManager.sh`

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/1c8d31f0.md]

⚠️ **The knowledge base contains information about the SSL certificate error pattern and fixes for related WebSphere products, but does not provide specific configuration steps for Decision Center + Scenario Service Provider HTTPS setup (such as importing certificates into truststore, configuring SSL in Decision Center, or SSP-specific HTTPS configuration).**

For the complete solution to your specific scenario, you'll need to refer to the official IBM Operational Decision Manager documentation on configuring SSL/TLS between Decision Center and Scenario Service Provider.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_Oy4ayMJDs5GTHwjfwDu1tl', content='     1→---
     2→id: "41e436fd"
     3→title: "フラッシュ(ALERTS)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/16/doc_2"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→フラッシュ(ALERTS)
    11→
    12→概要
    13→ IIBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0, WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V8.0 and WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V7.0 で提供されている Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) の GNU C library (glibc) に脆弱性が存在します。(CVE-2015-0235).
    14→
    15→本文
    16→IIBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0, WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V8.0 and WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V7.0 で提供されている Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) の GNU C library (glibc) に脆弱性が存在します。(CVE-2015-0235).
    17→GNU C Library (glibc)の__nss_hostname_digits_dots() 関数にバッファオーバフローの脆弱性が発見されました。(GHOSTと呼ばれます)
    18→これにより、遠隔の第三者による任意のコード実行が可能になる場合があります。
    19→
    20→【対象ソフトウェア】
    21→
    22→・IBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0
    23→
    24→・WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V7.0/8.0
    25→
    26→IBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0 と WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V8.0 は、Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 6.2を同梱しています。
    27→WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V7.0は、 Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 5.5を同梱しています。
    28→
    29→* Hypervisor Edition ではなく、IBM Integration BusもしくWebSphere Message Brokerを使用されている場合、該当いたしません。
    30→

FLASH (ALERT)

ABSTRACT
 IBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0 and WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V8.0 require customer action for security vulnerabilities in Red Hat Linux.

CONTENT
IBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0 and WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V8.0 ship with versions of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server that are vulnerable to CVE-2017-2619, CVE-2017-5509, CVE-2017-5510, CVE-2017-7275, CVE-2016-10228.

IBM Integration Bus Hypervisor Edition V9.0 and WebSphere Message Broker Hypervisor Edition V8.0 ship with Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Server 6.2.

    13→ A security vulnerability has been discovered in OpenSSL.
    14→
    15→VULNERABILITY DETAILS
    16→CVE ID: CVE-2014-0160 [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-0160]
    17→DESCRIPTION:
    18→OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the TLS/DTLS heartbeat functionality. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose 64k of private memory and retrieve secret keys. An attacker can repeatedly expose additional 64k chunks of memory. This vulnerability can be remotely exploited, authentication is not required and the exploit is not complex. An exploit can only partially affect the confidentially, but not integrity or availability.
    19→

    21→CVSS Base Score: 5

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_sbZkUqrjtkRJjTvEH63djs', content='     1→---
     2→id: "56ddb1a4"
     3→title: "APMUI; 5724G70UITR; scapm TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/32/doc_1"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→APMUI; 5724G70UITR; scapm TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ The LDAP user cannot log into the APMUI after implementing LDAP user registry as per instructions in the APMUI User Guide.
    14→
    15→SYMPTOM
    16→console.log in APMUI_HOME//usr/servers/apmui/logs has following messages:
    17→[AUDIT ] CWWKG0028A: Processing included configuration resource: /usr/Tivoli/APMUI/usr/shared/config/ldapRegistry.xml
    18→....
    19→[AUDIT ] CWWKS1100A: Authentication did not succeed for user ID apmadmin. An invalid user ID or password was specified.
    20→
    21→CAUSE
    22→LDAP properties in ldapRegistry.xml are not correct.
    23→
    24→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    25→ Section "Configuring an LDAP user registry for Liberty profile" of Application Performance Management User Interface (APMUI) User Guide has a sample ldapRegistry.xml. The properties in this sample are only examples, the settings in this file are dependent on the specific LDAP setup in your environment.
    26→
    27→1) Contact LDAP administrator to determine LDAP Server settings for APMUI users. Validate what filters must be used, as well as values for the bindDN and bindPassword etc, based on how the LDAP Directory Information Tree (DIT) is configured.
    28→
    29→The meaning of various properties in the ldapRegistry.xml are as follows:
    30→
    31→baseDN: specifies the starting point in the LDAP (DIT) for all LDAP searches
    32→bindDN: specifies the distinguished name for the application server to use when it attempts to bind to the LDAP server
    33→bindPwd: specifies the password for the application server to user when binding to LDAP
    34→
    35→The filters:
    36→
    37→userFilter: defines the filter is used to search LDAP for users
    38→groupFilter: defines the filter used to search LDAP for groups
    39→userIdMap: specifies the LDAP filter that maps the short name of a user to an LDAP entry
    40→groupIdMap: specifies the LDAP filter that maps the short name of a group to an LDAP entry
    41→groupMemberIdMap: specifies the LDAP filter that identifies user-to-group relationships. It specifies which property of an objectclass stores the list of members belonging to the group represented by the objectclass.
    42→
    43→The filters do not need to be specified. If they are not specified they contain default values depending on the LDAP server type (IBM Directory Server, Microsoft Active Directory etc). So these are always required, but if the default values match with the LDAP tree's configuration, then they do no need to be explicitly specified in the server.xml file.
    44→
    45→For Active Directory, if no filters are specified, the default values for the filters are as follows:
    46→
    47→// Active Directory LDAP
    48→
    49→filters.put(LdapConfig.USER_FILTER, "(&(sAMAccountName=%v)(objectcategory=user))");
    50→filters.put(LdapConfig.GROUP_FILTER, "(&(cn=%v)(objectcategory=group))");
    51→filters.put(LdapConfig.USER_ID_MAP, "user:sAMAccountName");
    52→filters.put(LdapConfig.GROUP_ID_MAP, "*:cn");
    53→filters.put(LdapConfig.GROUP_MEMBER_ID_MAP, "memberof:member");
    54→
    55→Again, these should match with how the LDAP server is actually set up in terms of objectclasses, and attributes on the LDAP entries. The LDAP admin can confirm the same.
    56→
    57→2) Use ldapsearch utility to verify the settings in ldapRegistry.xml.
    58→
    59→Note: If you have IBM Lotus Notes installed, ldapsearch utility can be found under "notes" directory.
    60→
    61→For example, if the ldapRegistry is setup as follows:
    62→<server>
    63→<ldapRegistry id="ldap" realm="SampleLdapADRealm"
    64→ldapType="Microsoft Active Directory"
    65→host="apmldap.sc.us.ibm.com" port="389" ignoreCase="true"
    66→baseDN="cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,dc=ibm,dc=com"
    67→bindDN="cn=apmadmin,cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,dc=ibm,dc=com"
    68→bindPassword="testpassword"
    69→userFilter="(&(sAMAccountName=%v)(objectcategory=user))"
    70→groupFilter="(&(cn=%v)(objectcategory=group))"
    71→userIdMap="user:sAMAccountName"
    72→groupIdMap="*:cn"
    73→groupMemberIdMap="memberOf:member">
    74→</ldapRegistry>
    75→</server>
    76→
    77→
    78→
    79→The following command matches what the APMUI Liberty Profile server does at runtime to authenticate user apmadmin based on above ldapRegistry.xml settings:
    80→ldapSearch -h apmldap.sc.us.ibm.com -p 389 -b cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,DC=ibm,DC=com -D cn=apmadmin,cn=users,dc=sc,dc=us,dc=ibm,dc=com -w testpassword uid=apmadmin
    81→
    82→Here the parameters to ldapsearch tool are as follows:
    83→
    84→-h host ldap server [server.acme.com]
    85→-p port port on ldap server [389]
    86→
    87→-b baseDN base dn for search [""]
    88→
    89→-D bindDN bind dn for simple authentication [NULL i.e. anonymous]
    90→
    91→If the ldapsearch command does not execute successfully, then this confirms that the issue is with the
    92→ldapRegistry.xml settings.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_Q1ViH8ucAjgf9QoNHXm7GY', content='     1→---
     2→id: "8aa1cb76"
     3→title: "TECHNOTE (FAQ)"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/32/doc_4"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ When launching the OpenPages reporting framework generation process, it is completing with errors. When clicking on 'Cognos Framework Generation' sub operation, why is the log showing: ERROR! java.net.ConnectException: Tried all: '1' addresses, but could not connect over HTTP to server?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→The OpenPages application is unable to connect to URL and port utilized by the OpenPages Framework Model Service.
    17→
    18→ANSWER
    19→When an OpenPages 5.x administrator reviews the Cognos Framework Generation sub operation task, the log records:
    20→
    21→Cognos Framework Generation [OPENPAGES_DEFAULT]: ERROR! java.net.ConnectException: Tried all: '1' addresses, but could not connect over HTTP to server: 'myreportingserver.ibm.com', port: '9080'
    22→
    23→where myreportingserver.ibm.com is name of the reporting server and the OpenPages Framework Model Service is listening on port 9080.
    24→
    25→When an OpenPages 6.x administrator reviews the Reporting Framework Subprocess sub operation task, the log records:
    26→
    27→Generating Framework Model, Facts and Dimensions, Custom Query Subjects. [DEFAULT]: ERROR! java.net.ConnectException: Tried all: '1' addresses, but could not connect over HTTP to server: 'myreportingserver.ibm.com', port: '8080'
    28→
    29→where myreportingserver.ibm.com is name of the reporting server and the OpenPages Framework Model Service is listening on port 8080.
    30→
    31→In most instances, the OpenPages administrator does not have the OpenPages Framework Model Service up and running on the reporting server. If the issue is occurring for a new installation, there could be a firewall blocking the connection.
    32→
    33→To resolve the issue, an administrator should start the service and verify that the application server can make a valid connection.
    34→
    35→RELATED INFORMATION
    36→#Reporting Framework Troubleshooting Steps [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21514115]
    37→Integration Between OpenPages and Cognos [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21628148]

     8→---
     9→
    10→APM; V8.1.3; V8.1.4; keystore; truststore; files; expired; expiring; upgrading; apmui; oidc; directory; certificate; server; installation TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ The APM V8.1.3 default certificate that is provided for the OIDC service is set to expire 2 years after the APM V8.1.3 server is installed. APM V8.1.3 was released (GA'd) on the 1st of May, 2016. This 2 year time frame is expiring now or very soon for customers who installed APM V8.1.3 at the time it was released (GA'd) or soon after it released, and have not either configured custom certificates or upgraded to APM V8.1.4.
    14→
    15→The APM V8.1.3 APMUI default certificate is hardcoded to expire on the 21st of April, 2019.
    16→
    17→SYMPTOM
    18→How will I know if the OIDC certificate has expired?
    19→
    20→When the OIDC certificate has expired, users will receive a "Secure Connection Failed" message in their browser instead of the APM 8.1.3 Login Page.
    21→
    22→How will I know if the APMUI certificate has expired?
    23→
    24→When the APMUI certificate has expired, users will receive a "Your connection is not secure" message that indicates the APM UI certificate has expired when navigating to APM server port 9443.
    25→
    26→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    27→To maintain valid UI certificates for installations that are still using the default out-of-the-box certificates, the existing keystore files must be replaced with the keystore files that are attached at the end of this technote.
    28→
    29→The following new keystore files that are attached to this technote contain certificates that expire in 2028.
    30→
    31→1. updated.8.1.3.oidc.key.jks (password: ccmR0cKs!)
    32→2. updated.8.1.3.apmui.key.jks (password: apmpass)
    33→3. updated.8.1.3.trust.jks (password: ccmR0cKs!)
    34→
    35→How will I know if I need to update my existing keystore files?
    36→

    40→ * There's only a single certificate listed.
    41→ * Alias is "default".
    42→ * Valid for a two year period.
    43→ * Signature Algorithm is SHA256withRSA.
    44→ * Owner: CN=localhost, O=IBM, OU=oidc, C=US and Issuer: CN=localhost, O=IBM, OU=oidc, C=US

    48→# cd /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/oidc/resources/security
    49→
    50→1.2. List the certificates in the key store by issuing the following command:
    51→
    52→# /opt/ibm/java/jre/bin/keytool -v -list -keystore ./key.jks
    53→
    54→Enter the keystore password: ccmR0cKs!

   176→
   177→Procedures
   178→
   179→Installation procedure (using /opt/ibm as the install directory)
   180→
   181→1. Download the new keystore files attached at the end of this technote into a temporary directory (/ tmp) on the APM server.
   182→
   183→2. Stop APM by issuing the following command:
   184→
   185→apm stop_all
   186→
   187→3. Back up the existing OIDC keystore by issuing the following command:
   188→
   189→cp /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/oidc/resources/security/key.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/oidc/resources/security/key.jks.BAK
   190→
   191→4. Install the new OIDC keystore (replace the existing file) by issuing the following command:
   192→
   193→cp /tmp/updated.8.1.3.oidc.key.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/oidc/resources/security/key.jks
   194→
   195→5. Back up the existing APMUI keystore by issuing the following command:
   196→
   197→cp /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/apmui/resources/security/key.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/apmui/resources/security/key.jks.BAK
   198→
   199→6. Install the new APMUI keystore (replace the exiting file) by issuing the following command:
   200→
   201→cp /tmp/updated.8.1.3.apmui.key.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/servers/apmui/resources/security/key.jks
   202→
   203→7. Back up the existing UI truststore by issuing the following command:
   204→
   205→cp /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/shared/resources/security/trust.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/shared/resources/security/trust.jks.BAK
   206→
   207→8. Install the new UI truststore (replace the existing file) by issuing the following command:
   208→
   209→cp /tmp/updated.8.1.3.trust.jks /opt/ibm/wlp/usr/shared/resources/security/trust.jks
   210→
   211→9. Restart APM by issuing the following command:
   212→
   213→apm start_all
   214→
   215→Verification procedure - verifying the installation of the new keystore files
   216→
   217→1. After APM is restarted, navigate to the APMUI at https://<APM_server_hostname>:9443 [https://apm_server_hostname:9443/]
   218→
   219→where <APM_server_hostname> is the hostname of your V8.1.3 APM server.
   220→
   221→2. Verify that the APM Log in page appears and log in.
   222→
   223→3. Verify that agent data is shown on the APM dashboard. Note: The passwords for the keystores and truststore are the same as the passwords that were shipped in APM V8.1.3, therefore, you don't need to update theserver.xml and serverVariables.xml files.

    10→5724G70UITR TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ Which roles must a user have to integrate APMUI console in DASH?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→The DASH admin user may be defined on a different user repository from the APMUI user registry. For APMUI console integration to succeed, the DASH admin user must be defined in a common user repository for both APMUI and DASH servers.
    17→
    18→ANSWER
    19→Below steps can be used to give administrative roles to a user from the APMUI user registry, and then log into DASH as this user to perform the console integration steps.
    20→
    21→1) Define user repository of APMUI in DASH.
    22→2) Identify a user from APMUI user repository to be granted admin role in DASH (the example below uses apmadmin user)
    23→3) Follow these steps to assign admin roles to the user:
    24→
    25→3.1 Log into DASH as a user with administrator privileges, select Console Settings->User Roles option.
    26→
    27→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=1]
    28→
    29→3.2 On the User Roles page, type the ID of APMUI user (for example, apmadmin) and then click the "Search" button. Click the link for the user in returned search results.
    30→
    31→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=2] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=2]
    32→
    33→3.3 Select the "administrator" and "iscadmins" roles and then click "Save".
    34→
    35→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=3] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21903489&aid=3]
    36→
    37→4) Use this administrative user to perform console integration steps.
    38→
    39→RELATED INFORMATION
    40→ Integrating APMUI with DASH [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSATHD_7.7.0/com.ibm.apm.doc_77/apm_ui_docs/apmui_77/integrate_APMUI_with_DASH.html]
    41→DASH - Adding the LDAP user registry as a federated rep [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEKCU_1.1.1.0/com.ibm.psc.doc_1.1.1.0/config/psc_t_config_add_ldap_rep.html]

query: Help with Security Bulletin: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java Runtime affect WMB and IIB I need to understand details regarding Security Bulletin: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java Runtime affect WebSphere Message Broker and IBM Integration Bus. Where can I find this information?
answer:
I found detailed information about the IBM Java Runtime vulnerabilities affecting WebSphere Message Broker and IBM Integration Bus. Here's what the knowledge base contains:

## Security Bulletin Overview

**CVE-2016-3485** - Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java Runtime affect WebSphere Message Broker (WMB) and IBM Integration Bus (IIB), disclosed in July 2016.

### Affected Products and Versions

- **IBM Integration Bus V10, V9**
- **WebSphere Message Broker V8**

### Affected Java Runtime Versions

- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 6.0.16.26 and earlier (used by WMB)
- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 7.0.9.40 and earlier (used by WMB and IIB)
- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 7.1.3.40 and earlier (used by IIB)

### Vulnerability Details

- **CVSS Base Score**: 2.9
- **Impact**: Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Networking component
  - No confidentiality impact
  - Low integrity impact
  - No availability impact
- **CVSS Vector**: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N)

### Remediation/Fixes

| Product | APAR | Fix |
|---------|------|-----|
| IBM Integration Bus V10 | IT16743 | Available in fix pack 10.0.0.7 |
| IBM Integration Bus V9 | IT16743 | Available in fix pack 9.0.0.7 |
| WebSphere Message Broker V8 | IT16743 | Interim fix available from IBM Fix Central; included in fix pack 8.0.0.9 |

**Special note for WMB V8**: If running fix pack earlier than 8.0.0.7 without IT03599 applied, you must upgrade to 8.0.0.7 or higher, or request IT16735 via IBM support.

### Where to Find More Information

- **Primary Security Bulletin**: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21994213
- **IBM Fix Central**: http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/
- **Recommended Fixes**: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27006041
- **Planned Maintenance Dates**: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27006308

[TextBlock(text="I found detailed information about the IBM Java Runtime vulnerabilities affecting WebSphere Message Broker and IBM Integration Bus. Here's what the knowledge base contains:

## Security Bulletin Overview

**CVE-2016-3485** - Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java Runtime affect WebSphere Message Broker (WMB) and IBM Integration Bus (IIB), disclosed in July 2016.

### Affected Products and Versions

- **IBM Integration Bus V10, V9**
- **WebSphere Message Broker V8**

### Affected Java Runtime Versions

- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 6.0.16.26 and earlier (used by WMB)
- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 7.0.9.40 and earlier (used by WMB and IIB)
- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 7.1.3.40 and earlier (used by IIB)

### Vulnerability Details

- **CVSS Base Score**: 2.9
- **Impact**: Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Networking component
  - No confidentiality impact
  - Low integrity impact
  - No availability impact
- **CVSS Vector**: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N)

### Remediation/Fixes

| Product | APAR | Fix |
|---------|------|-----|
| IBM Integration Bus V10 | IT16743 | Available in fix pack 10.0.0.7 |
| IBM Integration Bus V9 | IT16743 | Available in fix pack 9.0.0.7 |
| WebSphere Message Broker V8 | IT16743 | Interim fix available from IBM Fix Central; included in fix pack 8.0.0.9 |

**Special note for WMB V8**: If running fix pack earlier than 8.0.0.7 without IT03599 applied, you must upgrade to 8.0.0.7 or higher, or request IT16735 via IBM support.

### Where to Find More Information

- **Primary Security Bulletin**: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21994213
- **IBM Fix Central**: http://www.ibm.com/support/fixcentral/
- **Recommended Fixes**: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27006041
- **Planned Maintenance Dates**: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27006308

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/7d8aa1b1.md, docs/ragbench-techqa/1f71b3ff.md]")]

## Security Bulletin Overview

**CVE-2016-3485** - Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java Runtime affect WebSphere Message Broker (WMB) and IBM Integration Bus (IIB), disclosed in July 2016.

### Affected Products and Versions

- **IBM Integration Bus V10, V9**
- **WebSphere Message Broker V8**

### Affected Java Runtime Versions

- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 6.0.16.26 and earlier (used by WMB)
- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 7.0.9.40 and earlier (used by WMB and IIB)
- IBM Runtime Environment Java Technology Edition 7.1.3.40 and earlier (used by IIB)

### Vulnerability Details

- **CVSS Base Score**: 2.9
- **Impact**: Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Networking component
  - No confidentiality impact
  - Low integrity impact
  - No availability impact
- **CVSS Vector**: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N)

query:
Port number error starting 9.0 Launcher 

I'm attempting to start up v9.0 for the first time with one .msl file on a Windows server and get the following error.  I also have v8.4 on this server and it starts fine.  I do not have v8.4 running when I attempt to start v9.0.

Cannot recognize if the system RecordChangeSystem.msl; has started. Reason: Server is unable to get the status of the system on port number 6,002.

I have the port range set to 7000/8000.  Why am I seeing this?
answer:
Based on the documentation I found, your issue is related to **port range configuration in WebSphere Transformation Extender (WTX) Launcher**.

The error message indicates that the system is trying to use port 6,002 (which is outside your configured range of 7000-8000), suggesting a **port configuration mismatch**.

## Why This Happens

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/198a9314.md > PROBLEM CONCLUSION > ID: 772734]

WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port conflicts when multiple installations are present. The documentation explains:

> "WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port conflicts when multiple installations are present on multiple hosts. To set port numbers in this situation so that you avoid port conflicts, adjust the starting port numbers of each installation to be in a different range from the other installations."

## Solution

When creating profiles with different versions on the same server, you need to explicitly set the starting port to ensure the new version uses your intended port range:

**Use the `-startingPort` option when creating the profile:**

```
bin/manageprofiles.sh -create -profileName <ProfileName> 
  -profilePath <path> 
  -templatePath <template> 
  -startingPort 7000
```

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/198a9314.md > lines 201-205]

This ensures that v9.0 will use ports starting from 7000 (within your 7000-8000 range) instead of trying to use the default port 6,002.

**Note:** The documentation also mentions that "Node agents do not inherit the starting port number from the deployment manager. If needed, manually change the port number settings."

⚠️ The documents found are about WebSphere Application Server, not specifically WTX Launcher. However, the port configuration principles should apply similarly. If this doesn't resolve your issue, you may need to check the WTX Launcher-specific configuration files for port settings.

   143→   PM91596 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PM91596] added a new bootstrap.properties parameter:
   144→   server.start.wait.time
   145→   This bootstrap.properties parameter is not
   146→   documented in the Knowledge Center and should be
   147→
   148→   Resolution: Topic, Specifying Liberty bootstrap properties, is
   149→   updated to read:
   150→   Use custom properties to configure server start wait time.
   151→
   152→   You can increase the server start wait time beyond the product
   153→   default setting by adding the server.start.wait.time property
   154→   to the boostrap.properties file. The server.start.wait.time is
   155→   specified in seconds.
   156→
   157→       Specify the server.start.wait.time property in the
   158→   bootstrap.properties file. The following example sets the
   159→   server start time to 25 seconds.
   160→
   161→       server.start.wait.time = 25
   162→
   163→       This setting means that as the server starts, the
   164→   reporting mechanism for the server attempts to report on the
   165→   completed stages of the start. If the reporting mechanism for
   166→   the server cannot perform its function within 25 seconds, an
   167→   error 22 occurs.
   168→
   169→       If you do not add the server.start.wait.time property to
   170→   the bootstrap.properties file, the default server start wait
   171→   time is internally set to 30 seconds.
   172→
   173→   This update also applies to V9.0
   174→   -----------
   175→   ID: 772734
   176→   Problem:Topic, Configuring port settings, is missing
   177→   information about configuring to set port numbers in a
   178→   different port range so that they cannot conflict.
   179→   Resolution: Topic, Configuring port settings, is update to add
   180→   a third optional step that reads:
   181→   Optional: Set port numbers in a different port range so that
   182→   they cannot conflict.
   183→
   184→   WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port
   185→   conflicts when multiple installations are present on multiple
   186→   hosts. To set port numbers in this situation so that you avoid
   187→   port conflicts, adjust the starting port numbers of each
   188→   installation to be in a different range from the other
   189→   installations.
   190→
   191→   For example, in a system with two installations, you can
   192→   configure one installation to use the default port number
   193→   settings, and manually assign a different port range in the
   194→   second installation.
   195→
   196→       Create the deployment manager of the second installation
   197→   by using the manageprofiles command. On the -startingPort
   198→   option, set a starting port number that is out of range of any
   199→   ports that other installations use.
   200→
   201→       bin/manageprofiles.sh -create -profileName Dmgr03
   202→   -profilePath
   203→       /opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer_2/profiles/Dmgr03 -templatePath
   204→       /opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServer_2/profileTemplates/management
   205→   -startingPort 15000
   206→
   207→       Create the application server or custom profiles on each
   208→   target machine.
   209→       Federate the profiles to the deployment manager by running
   210→   the addNode command.
   211→       Create clusters and cluster members from the deployment
   212→   manager.
   213→
   214→       New servers that you create inherit the higher starting
   215→   port number from the deployment manager.
   216→       Note: Node agents do not inherit the starting port number
   217→   from the deployment manager. If needed, manually change the
   218→   port number settings.
   219→
   220→   Tip: You can use the Profile Port Checker tool to check for
   221→   conflicts without needing to start the servers. Note that the
   222→   tool checks only for conflicts on the machine where it runs.
   223→   For information about using the Profile Port Checker, see
   224→   Using the Profile Port Checker.

[TextBlock(text='Based on the documentation I found, your issue is related to **port range configuration in WebSphere Transformation Extender (WTX) Launcher**.

The error message indicates that the system is trying to use port 6,002 (which is outside your configured range of 7000-8000), suggesting a **port configuration mismatch**.

## Why This Happens

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/198a9314.md > PROBLEM CONCLUSION > ID: 772734]

WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port conflicts when multiple installations are present. The documentation explains:

> "WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port conflicts when multiple installations are present on multiple hosts. To set port numbers in this situation so that you avoid port conflicts, adjust the starting port numbers of each installation to be in a different range from the other installations."

## Solution

When creating profiles with different versions on the same server, you need to explicitly set the starting port to ensure the new version uses your intended port range:

**Use the `-startingPort` option when creating the profile:**

```
bin/manageprofiles.sh -create -profileName <ProfileName> 
  -profilePath <path> 
  -templatePath <template> 
  -startingPort 7000
```

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/198a9314.md > lines 201-205]

This ensures that v9.0 will use ports starting from 7000 (within your 7000-8000 range) instead of trying to use the default port 6,002.

**Note:** The documentation also mentions that "Node agents do not inherit the starting port number from the deployment manager. If needed, manually change the port number settings."

⚠️ The documents found are about WebSphere Application Server, not specifically WTX Launcher. However, the port configuration principles should apply similarly. If this doesn't resolve your issue, you may need to check the WTX Launcher-specific configuration files for port settings.')]

messages.result:
Based on the documentation I found, your issue is related to **port range configuration in WebSphere Transformation Extender (WTX) Launcher**.

The error message indicates that the system is trying to use port 6,002 (which is outside your configured range of 7000-8000), suggesting a **port configuration mismatch**.

## Why This Happens

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/198a9314.md > PROBLEM CONCLUSION > ID: 772734]

WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port conflicts when multiple installations are present. The documentation explains:

> "WebSphere Application Server cannot always detect port conflicts when multiple installations are present on multiple hosts. To set port numbers in this situation so that you avoid port conflicts, adjust the starting port numbers of each installation to be in a different range from the other installations."

## Solution

When creating profiles with different versions on the same server, you need to explicitly set the starting port to ensure the new version uses your intended port range:

**Use the `-startingPort` option when creating the profile:**

```
bin/manageprofiles.sh -create -profileName <ProfileName> 
  -profilePath <path> 
  -templatePath <template> 
  -startingPort 7000
```

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/198a9314.md > lines 201-205]

This ensures that v9.0 will use ports starting from 7000 (within your 7000-8000 range) instead of trying to use the default port 6,002.

**Note:** The documentation also mentions that "Node agents do not inherit the starting port number from the deployment manager. If needed, manually change the port number settings."

⚠️ The documents found are about WebSphere Application Server, not specifically WTX Launcher. However, the port configuration principles should apply similarly. If this doesn't resolve your issue, you may need to check the WTX Launcher-specific configuration files for port settings.

query: Installing fixpacks with Installation Manager - when did it change from using updateInstaller,  starting in which version of WebSphere I was using updateInstaller to install fixpacks, and there was a separate fixpack for WebSphere and separate for the JDK, independent of each other. Now I understand that with Installation Manager there is a single package containing both the WebSphere App server fixpack as well as the JDK. When did this occur, starting with which version of WebSphere ?
answer:
Based on the documentation I found, here's the answer to your question:

**The change from updateInstaller to Installation Manager occurred starting with WebSphere Application Server V8.0.**

According to the IBM documentation:

> "**WebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5**  
> Starting with V8.0 and applicable to all subsequent releases and fixpacks, there is one install package that contains updates for both WebSphere Application Server and Java SDK. Applying fixpacks of WebSphere Application Server also upgrades the SDK that is packaged and bundled within the fixpack. Additionally, separate Java SDK fixpacks are also available that contain just the SDK updates which can be applied to upgrade the SDK."

**Key points:**

1. **Starting version**: WebSphere Application Server V8.0 introduced the bundled approach
2. **What changed**: Instead of separate fixpacks for WebSphere and JDK (as in V7.0 and earlier), V8.0+ provides a single package containing both
3. **Flexibility**: While the bundled approach is the default, separate Java SDK fixpacks are still available if you need to upgrade just the SDK

**For earlier versions (V7.0 and below):**
- WebSphere fixpacks and Java SDK updates were managed separately
- You would use updateInstaller to apply these separate fixpacks

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/affd7de2.md > Policy Summary by WebSphere Application Server release]
