[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_6QlG3v73oKf8G3ESKR1rBv', content='{"result":"[\\n  {\\n    \\"score\\": 1.0341,\\n    \\"doc_id\\": \\"affd7de2\\",\\n    \\"chunk_id\\": \\"affd7de2-000\\",\\n    \\"chunk_index\\": 0,\\n    \\"path\\": \\"docs/ragbench-techqa/affd7de2.md\\",\\n    \\"title\\": \\"upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\",\\n    \\"section_path\\": \\"\\",\\n    \\"confidence\\": \\"medium\\",\\n    \\"text\\": \\"upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n What is the Java™ SDK upgrade policy for the IBM® WebSphere® Application Server?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nUpdating to the latest compatible Java SDK could help you resolve problems more quickly.\\\\n\\\\nANSWER\\\\nThe IBM WebSphere Application Server Java SDK can be upgraded to the latest service release for the same Java SDK version.\\\\n\\\\nList of WebSphere Application Server fix packs and the corresponding Java SDK versions [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27005002]\\\\n\\\\nPolicy Summary by WebSphere Application Server release:\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5\\\\nStarting with V8.0 and applicable to all subsequent releases and fixpacks, there is one install package that contains updates for both WebSphere Application Server and Java SDK. Applying fixpacks of WebSphere Application Server also upgrades the SDK that is packaged and bundled within the fixpack. Additionally, separate Java SDK fixpacks are also available that contain just the SDK updates which can be applied to upgrade the SDK.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V7.0\\\\nAny V7.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.6.0 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V6.1\\\\nAny V6.1 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.5.0 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V6.0\\\\nAny V6.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.4.2 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V5.1\\\\nAny V5.1 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.4.1 and any V5.1.1 can be upgraded to the latest Java SDK 1.4.2 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server V5.0\\\\nAny V5.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.3.1 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.\\\\n\\\\nDetails of Java SDK Upgrade Policy\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server leverages the Java SDK as a base component. This results in unique support issues, including:\\\\n\\\\n * Matching Java SDK service releases to Application Server releases and fix packs\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n * Delivering updates and fixes associated with the Java SDK on any given Application Server release.\\\\n\\\\nIn an effort to resolve customer Java SDK situations as quickly as possible, WebSphere Application Server Support has done a quickest-path-to-resolution analysis, determining the most direct way to collect problem information.\\\\n\\\\nIn some cases, problem resolution might include finding shortcuts to resolve symptoms. One shortcut is an immediate upgrade to a newer compatible Java SDK service release, before gathering detailed problem determination data.\\\\n\\\\nThere are multiple advantages to performing an immediate Java SDK upgrade as a quicker path to resolution over a full Problem Determination (PD) process:\\\\n 1. There is a continuous stream of fixes going into the Java SDK. Many problems encountered by customers are resolved by these fixes.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2. When a new problem is encountered, applying the latest Java SDK is a quick way to determine if related fixes change the symptoms or correct the problem.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Many documented Java SDK fixes have common symptoms. Frequently, limited PD data does not isolate the problem to a single root cause.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nThese factors highlight the advantage of applying a newer Java SDK before working through a full PD cycle.\\\\n\\\\nJava SDK and WebSphere Application Server software are updated frequently. To avoid compatibility issues for customers, WebSphere Application Server Support maintains this Java SDK Upgrade Policy.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server Support details:\\\\nhttp://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/support.html [http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/support.html]\\\\n\\\\nIdentifying compatibility limitations between WebSphere Application Server releases and Java SDK service releases that have not been tested together reduces risk.\\\\n\\\\nImportant: Using a Java SDK not specifically packaged with WebSphere Application Server and supplied by IBM, or in violation of the Java SDK Upgrade Policy, is not supported by IBM WebSphere Application Server Support for Java SDK problems. WEBCAST\\\\n\\\\nABSTRACT\\\\n IBM Ask the Experts discussion about WebSphere Application Server installation/uninstall/update/modify using Install Manager on 12 December 2013.\\\\nThis session covers install / uninstall / update / modify operations using Installation Manager on WebSphere Application Server V8.X This also covers any questions related to Install /Uninstall or applying fixpacks using Update Installer in v7.x\\\\n\\\\nCONTENT\\\\nAsk the Experts sessions are conducted in a question and answer format.\\\\n\\\\nThe table below provides a time index (minutes:seconds) to the recording and describes the questions or topics discussed.\\\\nYou can to fast forward to any question using the time index. A table containing the panel of experts is also included.\\\\n\\\\nTo play or download the audio of this Ask the Experts session, see the Audio Section of this document (audio not available until after the webcast).\\\\n\\\\nSee the Related Information Section of this document for a list of documents referenced during the presentation.\\\\n\\\\nAsk the Experts session\\\\n12 December 2013 - 11:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. EST\\\\n\\\\nTime Questions asked 00:00 General introduction 02:40 Technical introduction 03:38 How can I use command line options to find what is installed and what offerings are available in the repository? 06:05 What option can I use to uninstall ifix and fixpack? 07:43 IMShared directory is using a lot of space, is there an option to delete files from this directory? 11:27 Is it possible to change AppData agent directory from default after WebSphere Application Server and other offerings are installed? 15:24 What options do I have to install Liberty 8.5.5? 17:00 Open lines for live question and answer period 17:03 On a non-administrator install, does it have to be the user_home? Can it be directed to a shared (NFS) space? 17:40 What is the difference between WAS installation through IM and Silent mode installation? 19:21 How to import license from RAD 7.0 to 8.5.5 (trial version)? 19:51 Can you please give an overview of using IM to install ifix? 20:38 I have WAS ND 8.5.5 32-bit installed on a 32-bit linux server, and I have a new linux 64bit server that we want only the 64bit 8.5.5 WAS, and use the DMGR on the 32-bit server, how do we do this? 22:14 Why is IBM only providing Installation of WebSphere Application Server through Installation Mananger? 23:01 When we go for Ifix and when we go for fixpack, what is basic difference between those? 23:50 Can you pleasee give information about what is the use of Liberty profile and its advantages? 24:57 What do you recommend if there is a need to duplicate the WebSphere environment? 26:54 What are the basic pre-req checks for installation of Installation Manager? 28:19 Do you have a link for how to federate the 64-bit WAS ND APPSERVER to 32-bit DMGR, instructions/step (jython scripting) so it can be automated? 29:20 With WebSphere products changing the method of installation, is there a white paper, or recommended practices, for setting up a central repository? 30:33 Is there any way make a WAS back-up through Installation Manager? 30:52 Do we have to uninstall previous ifix before installing latest fix pack? 32:09 We are planning to migrate from WAS 6.1 to WAS8.5.5, can I install 8.5.5 on top of the existing 6.1 profile? Or does it have to be a fresh installation? 33:10 I have an NFS share on 3 servers and IIM is installed there. Can I utilize IIM to install/uninstall with 2 different users without any issues on all 3 servers? 34:44 Is there a document for migrating WebSphere 7 to WAS 8.7 entire cell, say node-by-node? 35:11 What provisions does WebSphere Application Server provide to prevent denial of service attacks? 35:40 If we have 32-bit 8.5.5 DMGR and 1 APPSRVR 32-bit 8.5.5 and a 2nd APPSRVR 64-bit 8.5.5, does the DMGR have to be updated first or can we update the APPServers first? That is, does the order matter for fixes? 36:58 Is it a good idea to create any dependency on the dmgr for runtime? For example, Adobe Life Cycle installed on top of WAS uses some cache mechanism called gds, gemfire, etc. 37:42 I noticed on IM with 8.5 that when you choose to install the updates, it always goes through your IBM PA account to get the updates and the latest. But with Maximo application for instance, you only want to go to 8.5.0.1 for instance, so the only way I found is run the update pointing to the repository for fix 1, and choose update and keep clicking cancel to look online to continue and install the fix 1. Is this the only way to install a fix on V8 or V8.5? 39:40 When migrating WAS from 6.1 to 8.5, do you guys recommend using the migration tool or create configurations using scripts? 40:44 To upgrade websphere from 6.1 to 8.5, What path do you suggest: fresh install or migration proces?. If you suggest migration process where can I get the documentation? 42:34 To get to WAS 8.0 from WAS 8.1, is this a migration process only? 42:57 What is the latest fix pack available on top of 8.5.5.0 base (and location to down load from Passport Advantage)? 43:37 Is there a fixed release scheduled for FixPacks? I hear that it\'s every 3 months or so. 44:24 If I have 1000 servers to apply FP, whats the recommended method to apply fixes to large number of servers in minimum time; any tools available? 47:01 I have IIM, WASND, WAS installed and configured per application\'s requirement. Now, I want to install another instance of WAS. Does IIM have an option to take the existing WAS as a template so that I can get the configuration also? 47:49 We are planning to upgrade from 6.1 to 8.5.5.0. What\'s the stable version (already being used by companies)? 48:45 Closing remarks 50:05 End of Call\\\\nPanel of Experts: Jeanette Daly WebSphere Application Server L2 Support Mike Hill WebSphere Application Server L2 Support Vishavpal Shergill WebSphere Application Server L2 Support Vikram Thommandru WebSphere Application Server L2 Support\\\\n\\\\nPRESENTATION\\\\n[http://www.ibm.com/i/v16/icons/weblecture.gif]WSTE-12122013-AskTheExperts-WebSphere_Application_Server_installation_update_uninstall.pdf [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27040108&aid=2]WSTE-12122013-AskTheExperts-WebSphere_Application_Server_installation_update_uninstall.pdf [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27040108&aid=1]\\\\n\\\\nGet Adobe Reader [http://www.adobe.com/products/acrobat/readstep2.html] to view PDF\\\\n\\\\nAUDIO\\\\n[http://www.ibm.com/i/v16/icons/aud.gif]To replay the recording of this conference call, click on Download Audio [http://public.dhe.ibm.com/software/websphere/techexchange/December-12-2013-Daly-Hill-Shergill-Thommandru.mp3](audio in MP3 format). ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n *  This APAR contains a fix to optimize how the workload\\\\n   management (WLM) component will compress and decompress data\\\\n   being sent betweenprocesses. This is designed to reduce\\\\n   compression overhead in large WebSphere Process Server or\\\\n   service integration bus (SIBus) topologies, specifically with\\\\n   a large number of destinations (more effective at 2,000 or more\\\\n   destinations). It addresses scenarios in which many clusters\\\\n   have been defined and one or more non-messaging engine (ME)\\\\n   clusters are restarted while the messaging engine cluster is\\\\n   running. A customer experiencing this may see the following:\\\\n\\\\n   ThreadMonitor W   WSVR0605W: Thread\\\\n   \\\\\\"server.startup : 0\\\\\\" (00000038) has been active for 686179\\\\n   milliseconds and may be hung.  There is/are 1 thread(s) in total\\\\n   in the server that may be hung.\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:199)\\\\n   at\\\\n   com.ibm.ws.sib.jfapchannel.impl.ExchangeReceiveListener.waitToCo\\\\n   mplete(ExchangeReceiveListener.java:235)\\\\n\\\\n   In addition this fixes a rare condition which could result in\\\\n   compressed data being lost.  This would only occur if a series\\\\n   of bytes to be compressed could not actually be compressed\\\\n   (every byte was unique). This would then cause a potential loss\\\\n   of data due to how WLM handled the uncompressed bytes.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  ****************************************************************\\\\n   * USERS AFFECTED:  IBM WebSphere Process Server users or users *\\\\n   *                  of IBM WebSphere Application Server with    *\\\\n   *                  service integration bus (SIBus)             *\\\\n   *                  configurations.                             *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: Workload management (WLM) Compressor    *\\\\n   *                      Fix and Enhancements                    *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   * RECOMMENDATION:                                              *\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   In scenarios in which many clusters have been defined\\\\n   and one or more non-ME clusters are restarted while the\\\\n   messaging engine cluster is running, a customer experiencing\\\\n   this may see the following:\\\\n\\\\n   ThreadMonitor W   WSVR0605W: Thread\\\\n   \\\\\\"server.startup : 0\\\\\\" (00000038) has been active for 686179\\\\n   milliseconds and may be hung.  There is/are 1 thread(s) in total\\\\n   in the server that may be hung.\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)\\\\n   at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:199)\\\\n   at\\\\n   com.ibm.ws.sib.jfapchannel.impl.ExchangeReceiveListener.waitToCo\\\\n   mplete(ExchangeReceiveListener.java:235)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  This APAR contains a fix to optimize how the WLM component\\\\n   will compress and decompress data being sent between\\\\n   processes. This is designed to reduce compression overhead in\\\\n   large WPS/SIB topologies, specifically with a large number of\\\\n   destinations (more effective at 2,000 or more destinations).\\\\n\\\\n   In addition this fixes a rare condition which could result in\\\\n   compressed data being lost.  This would only occur if a series\\\\n   of bytes to be compressed could not actually be compressed\\\\n   (every byte was unique). This would then cause a potential loss\\\\n   of data due to how WLM handled the uncompressed bytes.\\\\n\\\\n   Although it is not recommended, the compression optimizations\\\\n   can be removed and the code reverted back to the prior code if\\\\n   problems are seen by setting a cell level custom property:\\\\n\\\\n   In the administrative console, go to the Custom properties\\\\n   page for the cell.\\\\n\\\\n   System administration > Cell >  cell_name, and then, under\\\\n   Additional Properties, click Custom Properties\\\\n\\\\n   Create a new custom property with a name of:\\\\n\\\\n   IBM_CLUSTER_USE_LEGACY_COMPRESSOR\\\\n\\\\n   and a value of true.  Save, Synchronize the nodes and restart\\\\n   all of the processes in the cell to pick up this change.\\\\n\\\\n   The fix for this APAR is currently targeted for inclusion in\\\\n   fix packs 6.1.0.37 and 7.0.0.17.  Please refer to the\\\\n   Recommended Updates page for delivery information:\\\\n   http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27004980 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27004980]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTEMPORARY FIX\\\\n\\\\nCOMMENTS\\\\n\\\\nAPAR INFORMATION\\\\n * APAR NUMBER\\\\n (FAQ)\\\\n\\\\nQUESTION\\\\n When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?\\\\n\\\\nCAUSE\\\\nThe Operational Decision Manager version numbers use the standard IBM formatV.R.M.Fwhich stands for Version.Release.Modification.Fixpack. See the V.R.M.F Maintenance Stream Delivery Vehicle terminology explanation [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] for more details.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix pack numbers are the third and fourth digits in the IBM product version number, for example: 8.5.M.F.\\\\n\\\\nModification and fix packs include only bug fixes, so they do not affect the product functionality or your data.\\\\n\\\\nSee the following technotes to find out which update your installation need:\\\\n\\\\n * Finding the version of ODM product and fixes [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21627850] to determine the exact product versions that are installed on your machine.\\\\n\\\\n * Find the version of ODM components [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21400738] to determine the exact module or library versions that are deployed on your servers.\\\\n\\\\n * Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] to learn about the latest modification or fix pack that is available for your product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Operational Decision Manager detailed system requirements [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27023067] to verify that your configuration is supported with your current product version.\\\\n\\\\n * IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] to verify that your current version does not reach end of support in the near future.\\\\n\\\\nReferring to the last two documents above, you may find out that you need to migrate to the latest product version to ensure continued support of your applications. In that case, refer to technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725].\\\\n\\\\nThat being said, make sure to consider migrating to the latest version or release ( V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from the latest added features and improvements.\\\\nANSWER\\\\nAs with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:\\\\n\\\\n * Anticipate and avoid the risk of encountering defects already fixed.\\\\n * Apply the latest product improvements that are available (performance, for example).\\\\n * Maintain a serviceable system and be able to install an interim fix when required.\\\\n\\\\nWHEN TO UPDATE\\\\nThe latest modification or fix pack should be installed as soon as it is available.\\\\n\\\\nYou can subscribe to the IBM Support My Notifications [https://www.ibm.com/support/mynotifications] to be notified of any fix pack releases, and you can also bookmark the Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] page, which lists the latest modifications or fix packs.\\\\n\\\\nSee the technote Fix pack release notification for Operational Decision Manager [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593] to find out when a modification or fix pack will be available.\\\\n\\\\nBEFORE UPDATING\\\\n\\\\nThe databases used in the sample server are deleted and recreated during the update. If you are using those databases and want to save the existing content, perform the following steps before updating:\\\\n *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.\\\\n\\\\nA new profile is also created for the sample server, at the first server start following the installation of a modification or fix pack.\\\\n\\\\nIf you want to continue using the same ports, you must delete the existing profile prior. In the <ODM_HOME>/shared/bin folder, from the command line, run the command ../tools/ant/bin/ant forcedestroyprofile.\\\\n\\\\nNote: The sample server is not designed to be used in a production system. For a production system, you must create a dedicated profile and database that you update using the following steps.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING\\\\n\\\\nEach modification or fix pack page provides instructions on how to download and run the installer, in addition to providing a list of corrections that are included in the update.\\\\n\\\\nThe fix pack installation updates the following files and folders:  * JAR libraries in the installation directories, including <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\lib.\\\\n * EAR and WAR applications in the <ODMInstallDir>\\\\\\\\<Module>\\\\\\\\applicationservers\\\\\\\\<App Server> folders.\\\\n\\\\nOnce this is done, you perform these tasks:  * Repackage your client applications with the up-to-date libraries.\\\\n * Reapply product customizations to the up-to-date Java EE modules (EARs and WARs).\\\\n\\\\nNote that all customizations you developed before the update, for example modifications of the descriptors, must be reapplied to the new, up-to-date EARs and WARs. It is a good idea to document and automate those customizations using scripts to make the process easier and error-proof.\\\\n\\\\nFinally, you must update the client applications and ODM modules on your server or servers with the same settings as you deployed previously. If you redeploy the application, follow again the documentation instructions to deploy all ODM modules to your servers [http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/dmanager/v8r5m1/topic/com.ibm.odm.distrib.config/topics/odm_distrib_config.html].\\\\n\\\\nKeep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATING RULE EXECUTION SERVER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following applications in the application server:  *  jrules-res-xu-<server>.rar jrules-res-management-<server>.ear jrules-ssp-<server>.ear jrules-res-htds-<server>ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nNote: Updating the eXecution Unit RAR file requires a restart of the server.\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE DECISION CENTER\\\\n\\\\nUpdate the following application in your application server:\\\\n * jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nUPDATE THE EVENTS RUNTIME\\\\n\\\\n 1. Stop the event runtime application, wberuntimeear.\\\\n 2. Uninstall the following applications, if they exist:  * wbefileconnector\\\\n     * wbehttpconnector\\\\n     * wbejdbcconnector\\\\n     * wbejmsconnector\\\\n     * wbesoapconnector\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Update the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n 4. Start the application wberuntimeear.\\\\n\\\\nMake sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).\\\\n\\\\nADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS\\\\n * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. See our technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725] for more information.\\\\n * For JRules 7.1, you can refer to the JRules 7.1 list of fix packs [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27019787] and also Upgrading JRules to the latest V7.1 fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21474292] to learn how to apply the fix packs. But note that JRules 7.1 reaches end of support in September 2015 (see the IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] page). To ensure continued product support, plan an upgrade to the latest product version before that date.\\\\n\\\\nRELATED INFORMATION\\\\n Fix pack release notification for ODM [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593 ]\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Business Integration WebSphere ILOG JRules AVAILABLE\\\\nWebSphere MQ V7.0 Fix Pack 7.0.1.12 [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24037169]\\\\n\\\\nSUBSCRIBE\\\\nYou can track all active APARs for this component.\\\\n\\\\nAPAR STATUS\\\\n * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nERROR DESCRIPTION\\\\n *  WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS V7.0.1.5 (or later): Failure\\\\n   Data Capture (FDC) files\\\\n   with Probe\\\\n   ID JO076001 and JO205001 are generated following a remote\\\\n   connection to a Queue Manager that has conversation sharing\\\\n   disabled:\\\\n\\\\n   | Probe Id     :- JO076001\\\\n   | Component    :- RemoteFAP.MQOPEN(Hconn,MQOD,int,Phobj,Pi\\\\n   | Probe Type   :- INCORROUT\\\\n   | Comment1     :- MQOPEN reply expected\\\\n\\\\n   | Probe Id     :- JO205001\\\\n   | Component    :- RemoteConnection.removeHconn(RemoteTls,R\\\\n   | Probe Type   :- INCORROUT\\\\n   | Comment1     :- Hconn is not associated with this connection\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nLOCAL FIX\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM SUMMARY\\\\n *  ****************************************************************\\\\n   USERS AFFECTED:\\\\n   This issue affects users of the WebSphere MQ V7.0.1.5 Classes\\\\n   for Java/JMS (or later) who have established a remote connection\\\\n   to a Queue Manager via a channel that has Conversation Sharing\\\\n   disabled (SHARECNV=0 or SHARECNV=1).\\\\n\\\\n   This includes users of:\\\\n\\\\n   - The WebSphere MQ V7.0.1 Classes for JMS\\\\n   - The WebSphere MQ V7.0.1 Resource Adapter.\\\\n   - The WebSphere Application Server V7.0 and V8.0 WebSphere MQ\\\\n   messaging provider.\\\\n   - The WebSphere Application Server V6.1 WebSphere MQ messaging\\\\n   provider who have configured the WebSphere variable\\\\n   MQ_INSTALL_ROOT to point to a WebSphere MQ V7.0.1 installation.\\\\n\\\\n   Platforms affected:\\\\n   All Distributed (iSeries, all Unix and Windows)\\\\n   ****************************************************************\\\\n   PROBLEM SUMMARY:\\\\n   By default in the WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS,\\\\n   conversation\\\\n   sharing is enabled and set to 10 on the client side. The client\\\\n   only discovers that Conversation Sharing is disabled following\\\\n   negotiation with a Queue Manager on the completion of a\\\\n   connection over a Channel that has SHARECNV=0 or SHARECNV=1.\\\\n\\\\n   When a WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS application requests a\\\\n   remote connection to a Queue Manager the client first attempts\\\\n   to find an already established TCP/IP connection which can be\\\\n   shared. As part of this process the list of known TCP/IP\\\\n   connections are matched for their suitability, this list\\\\n   includes connections which are in the process of being\\\\n   established (MQCONN reply not received from the Queue Manager).\\\\n\\\\n   When a WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS application requested a\\\\n   remote connection it was matched for sharing with a connection\\\\n   that was still in the process of being established. The\\\\n   WebSphere MQ Client waited for the connection to complete and\\\\n   due to a small timing window began incorrectly sharing the\\\\n   connection without confirming the connection\'s suitability. If\\\\n   the connection\'s suitability had been checked then the\\\\n   connection\\\\n   would have been marked unsuitable due to the Negotiated Channel\\\\n   specifying that Conversation Sharing was disabled (SHARECNV=0 or\\\\n   SHARECNV=1).\\\\n   As the connection (which did not support conversation sharing)\\\\n   was now shared by two threads, packets destined for one thread\\\\n   were erroneously received by the other, this led to the client\\\\n   being in an inconsistent state and the two FDCs being generated.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nPROBLEM CONCLUSION\\\\n *  The WebSphere MQ Classes for Java/JMS have been modified to\\\\n   correctly restrict conversation sharing when using a connection\\\\n   that does not support conversation sharing (SHARECNV=0 or\\\\n   SHARECNV=1).\\\\n\\\\n   ---------------------------------------------------------------\\\\n   The fix is targeted for delivery in the following PTFs:\\\\n\\\\n   Version    Maintenance Level\\\\n The ZIP files in the download package section below can be used for setting up local repository to install SCA Fix Pack 1.0.1.19 using IBM Installation Manager.\\\\n\\\\nWebSphere Application Server feature packs are a mechanism for providing major new application server function between product releases. By delivering new functions and support for industry standards between product releases, you can more quickly explore and implement new technologies within your business applications in today\'s rapidly changing business environments.\\\\n\\\\nIBM WebSphere Application Server V7 Feature Pack for SCA [http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/featurepacks/sca/] delivers critical technology that enables adoption of key Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) principles. As part of the larger SOA Foundation, which straddles all of IBM software brands, this offering delivers an integrated, open implementation of Service Component Architecture (SCA), a technology specified by IBM and other industry leaders through the Open SOA Collaboration (OSOA). Install WebSphere Application Server Version 7.0.0.7 or later.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Install IBM Installation Manager. Install WebSphere Application Server V7.0.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 2. Install WebSphere Application Server Fix Pack 7.0.0.7 [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24024582] or later using the Update Installer [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24020212].\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 3. Install IBM Installation Manager. You can download and unpack a compressed file containing the IBM Installation Manager appropriate for your operating system from the IBM Installation Manager Web site [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24023498]. Start IBM Installation Manager.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 4. Import WebSphere Application Server into Installation Manager. Make sure to stop all servers and applications on the WebSphere Application Server installation that is being imported.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 5. Install Feature Pack for SCA Version 1.0.1 using IBM Installation Manager. This can be done by using either Web-based Repository or Local Repository. Whenever possible, you should use the remote Web-based repositories so that you are accessing the most up-to-date WebSphere Application Server base-product import and feature pack installation files. The feature-pack version of Installation Manager is preconfigured to use both the local repositories (if they are set up) and the remote repositories.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n 6. Install SCA Fix Pack 1.0.1.19 using Update option on IBM Installation Manager main page.      7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→upgrade policy TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ What is the Java™ SDK upgrade policy for the IBM® WebSphere® Application Server?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→Updating to the latest compatible Java SDK could help you resolve problems more quickly.
    17→
    18→ANSWER
    19→The IBM WebSphere Application Server Java SDK can be upgraded to the latest service release for the same Java SDK version.
    20→
    21→List of WebSphere Application Server fix packs and the corresponding Java SDK versions [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27005002]
    22→
    23→Policy Summary by WebSphere Application Server release:
    24→
    25→WebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5
    26→Starting with V8.0 and applicable to all subsequent releases and fixpacks, there is one install package that contains updates for both WebSphere Application Server and Java SDK. Applying fixpacks of WebSphere Application Server also upgrades the SDK that is packaged and bundled within the fixpack. Additionally, separate Java SDK fixpacks are also available that contain just the SDK updates which can be applied to upgrade the SDK.
    27→
    28→WebSphere Application Server V7.0
    29→Any V7.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.6.0 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.
    30→
    31→WebSphere Application Server V6.1
    32→Any V6.1 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.5.0 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.
    33→
    34→WebSphere Application Server V6.0
    35→Any V6.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.4.2 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.
    36→
    37→WebSphere Application Server V5.1
    38→Any V5.1 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.4.1 and any V5.1.1 can be upgraded to the latest Java SDK 1.4.2 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.
    39→
    40→WebSphere Application Server V5.0
    41→Any V5.0 fix pack can upgrade to the latest Java SDK 1.3.1 service release packaged for WebSphere Application Server.
    42→
    43→Details of Java SDK Upgrade Policy
    44→
    45→WebSphere Application Server leverages the Java SDK as a base component. This results in unique support issues, including:
    46→
    47→ * Matching Java SDK service releases to Application Server releases and fix packs
    48→
    49→
    50→ * Delivering updates and fixes associated with the Java SDK on any given Application Server release.
    51→
    52→In an effort to resolve customer Java SDK situations as quickly as possible, WebSphere Application Server Support has done a quickest-path-to-resolution analysis, determining the most direct way to collect problem information.
    53→
    54→In some cases, problem resolution might include finding shortcuts to resolve symptoms. One shortcut is an immediate upgrade to a newer compatible Java SDK service release, before gathering detailed problem determination data.
    55→
    56→There are multiple advantages to performing an immediate Java SDK upgrade as a quicker path to resolution over a full Problem Determination (PD) process:
    57→ 1. There is a continuous stream of fixes going into the Java SDK. Many problems encountered by customers are resolved by these fixes.
    58→
    59→
    60→ 2. When a new problem is encountered, applying the latest Java SDK is a quick way to determine if related fixes change the symptoms or correct the problem.
    61→
    62→
    63→ 3. Many documented Java SDK fixes have common symptoms. Frequently, limited PD data does not isolate the problem to a single root cause.
    64→
    65→
    66→These factors highlight the advantage of applying a newer Java SDK before working through a full PD cycle.
    67→
    68→Java SDK and WebSphere Application Server software are updated frequently. To avoid compatibility issues for customers, WebSphere Application Server Support maintains this Java SDK Upgrade Policy.
    69→
    70→WebSphere Application Server Support details:
    71→http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/support.html [http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/support.html]
    72→
    73→Identifying compatibility limitations between WebSphere Application Server releases and Java SDK service releases that have not been tested together reduces risk.
    74→
    75→Important: Using a Java SDK not specifically packaged with WebSphere Application Server and supplied by IBM, or in violation of the Java SDK Upgrade Policy, is not supported by IBM WebSphere Application Server Support for Java SDK problems. RELATED INFORMATION
    76→ Verify Java SDK version shipped with WebSphere fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg27005002]
    77→
    78→Cross reference information Segment Product Component Platform Version Edition Application Servers Runtimes for Java Technology Java SDK

[TextBlock(text='Based on the documentation I found, here's the answer to your question:

**The change from updateInstaller to Installation Manager occurred starting with WebSphere Application Server V8.0.**

According to the IBM documentation:

> "**WebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5**  
> Starting with V8.0 and applicable to all subsequent releases and fixpacks, there is one install package that contains updates for both WebSphere Application Server and Java SDK. Applying fixpacks of WebSphere Application Server also upgrades the SDK that is packaged and bundled within the fixpack. Additionally, separate Java SDK fixpacks are also available that contain just the SDK updates which can be applied to upgrade the SDK."

**Key points:**

1. **Starting version**: WebSphere Application Server V8.0 introduced the bundled approach
2. **What changed**: Instead of separate fixpacks for WebSphere and JDK (as in V7.0 and earlier), V8.0+ provides a single package containing both
3. **Flexibility**: While the bundled approach is the default, separate Java SDK fixpacks are still available if you need to upgrade just the SDK

**For earlier versions (V7.0 and below):**
- WebSphere fixpacks and Java SDK updates were managed separately
- You would use updateInstaller to apply these separate fixpacks

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/affd7de2.md > Policy Summary by WebSphere Application Server release]')]

messages.result:
Based on the documentation I found, here's the answer to your question:

**The change from updateInstaller to Installation Manager occurred starting with WebSphere Application Server V8.0.**

According to the IBM documentation:

> "**WebSphere Application Server V8.0, V8.5, V8.5.5**  
> Starting with V8.0 and applicable to all subsequent releases and fixpacks, there is one install package that contains updates for both WebSphere Application Server and Java SDK. Applying fixpacks of WebSphere Application Server also upgrades the SDK that is packaged and bundled within the fixpack. Additionally, separate Java SDK fixpacks are also available that contain just the SDK updates which can be applied to upgrade the SDK."

**Key points:**

1. **Starting version**: WebSphere Application Server V8.0 introduced the bundled approach
2. **What changed**: Instead of separate fixpacks for WebSphere and JDK (as in V7.0 and earlier), V8.0+ provides a single package containing both
3. **Flexibility**: While the bundled approach is the default, separate Java SDK fixpacks are still available if you need to upgrade just the SDK

**For earlier versions (V7.0 and below):**
- WebSphere fixpacks and Java SDK updates were managed separately
- You would use updateInstaller to apply these separate fixpacks

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/affd7de2.md > Policy Summary by WebSphere Application Server release]

import asyncio
import json
from mcp import ClientSession, StdioServerParameters
from mcp.client.stdio import stdio_client

async def search():
    server_params = StdioServerParameters(
        command='/home/shenzt/ws/knowledge-base-search/.venv/bin/python',
        args=['scripts/mcp_server.py'],
        env=None
    )
    
    async with stdio_client(server_params) as (read, write):
        async with ClientSession(read, write) as session:
            await session.initialize()
            result = await session.call_tool(
                'hybrid_search',
                arguments={
                    'query': 'db2jcc jar file removed JDBC driver database',
                    'top_k': 5
                }
            )
            print(json.dumps(result.model_dump(), indent=2, ensure_ascii=False))

asyncio.run(search())

query:
Additional steps to apply fix pack to Decision Center 

We are upgrading ODM 8.8.1 Decision Center to the latest 8.8.1.3.

Are there any additional steps to apply the fixpack to Decision Center after we install the fixpack with Installation Manager?
answer:
Based on the knowledge base search, I found relevant information about applying fix packs to ODM Decision Center. Here's what you need to know:

## Additional Steps After Installing Fix Pack with Installation Manager

Yes, there are additional steps required after installing the fix pack with Installation Manager. The installation only updates the JAR libraries and application files, but you need to apply these updates to your running environment.

### Key Steps for Decision Center:

**1. Update the Decision Center Application**
- Update `jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear` in your application server
- Ensure class loading policies remain "parent last" for all ODM modules

**2. Reapply Customizations**
- Any customizations you made to descriptors or configurations must be reapplied to the updated EAR/WAR files
- Document and automate these customizations using scripts to make the process easier

**3. Redeploy if Necessary**
- If you redeploy the application, follow the ODM distribution configuration documentation to deploy all modules to your servers

### Before Updating (Important):

**For Sample Server Users:**
- Stop the sample server
- Backup databases in `<ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby` (resdb and rtsdb folders)
- After installation, restore the backup before restarting

**Note:** The fix pack installation updates files in:
- `<ODMInstallDir>/<Module>/lib` (JAR libraries)
- `<ODMInstallDir>/<Module>/applicationservers/<App Server>` (EAR/WAR applications)

### General Principle:
Applying a modification or fix pack does not require data migration - your projects and database remain the same. However, you must update the deployed applications on your servers with the updated files.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md > UPDATE DECISION CENTER]

⚠️ The document provides general guidance for ODM fix pack application but does not include version-specific instructions for 8.8.1.3. For detailed version-specific steps, consult the fix pack's readme file or the official ODM 8.8.1.3 documentation.

    11→
    12→ABSTRACT
    13→ This cumulative fix pack updates Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1 to V8.5.1.1.
    14→
    15→DOWNLOAD DESCRIPTION
    16→This fix pack is entitled. Only customers who have purchased Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1 can use this fix pack.
    17→
    18→How to install the fix pack
    19→If you are not installing both components, skip the instructions regarding Decision Center or Decision Server.
    20→
    21→ 1. For Decision Center, download 8.5.1-WS-ODM_DC-<OS>-FP001.zip, and extract its files. (Change <OS> to match your platform: AIX, HPUX, LINUX, OS400, SOLARIS, ZOS, or WIN32.)
    22→ 2. Extract the archive to a new folder, named WDC.
    23→ 3. For Decision Server, Download 8.5.1-WS-ODM_DS-<OS>-FP001.zip, and extract its files. (Change <OS> to match your platform: AIX, HPUX, LINUX, OS400, SOLARIS, ZOS, or WIN32.)
    24→ 4. Extract the archive to a new folder, named WDS.
    25→
    26→Installing by using IBM Installation Manager:  1. Launch IBM Installation Manager.
    27→ 2. In the toolbar menu, open File > Preferences and do the following:
    28→ 3. Select repositories.  1. For Decision Center, click Add Repository.
    29→     2. Browse to the extracted folder WDC\updates.
    30→     3. Select the file repository.config.
    31→     4. For Decision Server, click Add Repository.
    32→     5. Browse to the extracted folder WDS\updates.
    33→     6. Select the file repository.config.
    34→     7. Make sure the repositories are selected in the Repositories list.
    35→
    36→
    37→ 4. Click Apply to save your changes, and click OK to close the Repositories list.
    38→ 5. Click Update to update your installation.
    39→ 6. Follow the instructions in the installation manager to complete the installation.
    40→
    41→Installing by using the Installation Manager command line:  1. Locate the imcl command under <IM installation>/eclipse/tools.
    42→ 2. Run the commandimcl updateAll -repositories WDC/updates,WDS/updates -acceptLicense.
    43→
    44→ * Use the option -installDirectory <install path of ODM 8.5.1> to update a specific installation.
    45→ * If you update only Decision Server or Decision Center, specify the repository accordingly.
    46→
    47→Applying the fix pack
    48→After you install the fix pack, you might have to do additional steps to apply the fix pack in your environment. To complete the update, see When and how to apply a modification or fix pack [http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665766].
    49→
    50→Warning:
    51→If you have installed interim fixes for Operational Decision Manager V8.5.1, you must uninstall the fixes before you can install this fix pack. You must also stop the Operational Decision Manager sample server for this installation. If you do not uninstall the fixes and stop the server, the installation of the fix pack will fail. If you attempt to install the fix pack without uninstalling the interim fixes, the installer will uninstall the interim fixes before it fails. In this case, stop the sample server and restart the installation. INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS

docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md: When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?
docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md:As with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:
docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md: *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.
docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md:Keep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.
docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md: * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. See our technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725] for more information.
docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md: * For JRules 7.1, you can refer to the JRules 7.1 list of fix packs [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27019787] and also Upgrading JRules to the latest V7.1 fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21474292] to learn how to apply the fix packs. But note that JRules 7.1 reaches end of support in September 2015 (see the IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] page). To ensure continued product support, plan an upgrade to the latest product version before that date.

     8→---
     9→
    10→fix pack update bug correction APAR TECHNOTE (FAQ)
    11→
    12→QUESTION
    13→ When and how should I apply a modification or fix pack to my JRules or Operational Decision Management (WODM/ODM) installation?
    14→
    15→CAUSE
    16→The Operational Decision Manager version numbers use the standard IBM formatV.R.M.Fwhich stands for Version.Release.Modification.Fixpack. See the V.R.M.F Maintenance Stream Delivery Vehicle terminology explanation [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27008656] for more details.
    17→
    18→Modification and fix pack numbers are the third and fourth digits in the IBM product version number, for example: 8.5.M.F.
    19→
    20→Modification and fix packs include only bug fixes, so they do not affect the product functionality or your data.
    21→
    22→See the following technotes to find out which update your installation need:
    23→
    24→ * Finding the version of ODM product and fixes [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21627850] to determine the exact product versions that are installed on your machine.
    25→
    26→ * Find the version of ODM components [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21400738] to determine the exact module or library versions that are deployed on your servers.
    27→
    28→ * Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] to learn about the latest modification or fix pack that is available for your product version.
    29→
    30→ * IBM Operational Decision Manager detailed system requirements [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27023067] to verify that your configuration is supported with your current product version.
    31→
    32→ * IBM Support Lifecycle [http://www.ibm.com/software/websphere/support/lifecycle/] to verify that your current version does not reach end of support in the near future.
    33→
    34→Referring to the last two documents above, you may find out that you need to migrate to the latest product version to ensure continued support of your applications. In that case, refer to technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725].
    35→
    36→That being said, make sure to consider migrating to the latest version or release ( V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from the latest added features and improvements.
    37→ANSWER
    38→As with any software product, even if you do not have any issues with running your current configuration, you should apply the latest modification or fix pack to take advantage of these benefits:
    39→
    40→ * Anticipate and avoid the risk of encountering defects already fixed.
    41→ * Apply the latest product improvements that are available (performance, for example).
    42→ * Maintain a serviceable system and be able to install an interim fix when required.
    43→
    44→WHEN TO UPDATE
    45→The latest modification or fix pack should be installed as soon as it is available.
    46→
    47→You can subscribe to the IBM Support My Notifications [https://www.ibm.com/support/mynotifications] to be notified of any fix pack releases, and you can also bookmark the Operational Decision Manager Download document [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24031636] page, which lists the latest modifications or fix packs.
    48→
    49→See the technote Fix pack release notification for Operational Decision Manager [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21665593] to find out when a modification or fix pack will be available.
    50→
    51→BEFORE UPDATING
    52→
    53→The databases used in the sample server are deleted and recreated during the update. If you are using those databases and want to save the existing content, perform the following steps before updating:
    54→ *  Stop the sample server. In the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby, create an archive file containing the resdb and rtsdb folders. Save the archive file, such as zip file, in the data folder. After installation, unzip the archive file in the folder <ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby to restore your databases before restarting the sample server.
    55→
    56→A new profile is also created for the sample server, at the first server start following the installation of a modification or fix pack.
    57→
    58→If you want to continue using the same ports, you must delete the existing profile prior. In the <ODM_HOME>/shared/bin folder, from the command line, run the command ../tools/ant/bin/ant forcedestroyprofile.
    59→
    60→Note: The sample server is not designed to be used in a production system. For a production system, you must create a dedicated profile and database that you update using the following steps.
    61→
    62→UPDATING
    63→
    64→Each modification or fix pack page provides instructions on how to download and run the installer, in addition to providing a list of corrections that are included in the update.
    65→
    66→The fix pack installation updates the following files and folders:  * JAR libraries in the installation directories, including <ODMInstallDir>\<Module>\lib.
    67→ * EAR and WAR applications in the <ODMInstallDir>\<Module>\applicationservers\<App Server> folders.
    68→
    69→Once this is done, you perform these tasks:  * Repackage your client applications with the up-to-date libraries.
    70→ * Reapply product customizations to the up-to-date Java EE modules (EARs and WARs).
    71→
    72→Note that all customizations you developed before the update, for example modifications of the descriptors, must be reapplied to the new, up-to-date EARs and WARs. It is a good idea to document and automate those customizations using scripts to make the process easier and error-proof.
    73→
    74→Finally, you must update the client applications and ODM modules on your server or servers with the same settings as you deployed previously. If you redeploy the application, follow again the documentation instructions to deploy all ODM modules to your servers [http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/dmanager/v8r5m1/topic/com.ibm.odm.distrib.config/topics/odm_distrib_config.html].
    75→
    76→Keep in mind that applying a modification or a fix pack does not require any data migration, so your projects and database remain the same.
    77→
    78→UPDATING RULE EXECUTION SERVER
    79→
    80→Update the following applications in the application server:  *  jrules-res-xu-<server>.rar jrules-res-management-<server>.ear jrules-ssp-<server>.ear jrules-res-htds-<server>ear
    81→
    82→Make sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).
    83→
    84→Note: Updating the eXecution Unit RAR file requires a restart of the server.
    85→
    86→UPDATE DECISION CENTER
    87→
    88→Update the following application in your application server:
    89→ * jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear
    90→
    91→Make sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).
    92→
    93→UPDATE THE EVENTS RUNTIME
    94→
    95→ 1. Stop the event runtime application, wberuntimeear.
    96→ 2. Uninstall the following applications, if they exist:  * wbefileconnector
    97→     * wbehttpconnector
    98→     * wbejdbcconnector
    99→     * wbejmsconnector
   100→     * wbesoapconnector
   101→
   102→
   103→ 3. Update the application wberuntimeear.
   104→ 4. Start the application wberuntimeear.
   105→
   106→Make sure you do not change the class loading policies for applications and modules ( parent last for all ODM modules).
   107→
   108→ADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS
   109→ * Again, in addition to applying the latest modification or fix pack, consider migrating to the latest version or release (V.R.M.F) of the product as soon as possible to benefit from recently added features and improvements. See our technote Migrating to the latest version of Operational Decision Management [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21589725] for more information.
   110→ * For JRules 7.1, you can refer to the JRules 7.1 list of fix packs [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27019787] and also Upgrading JRules to the latest V7.1 fix pack [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21474292] to learn how to apply the fix packs. [TextBlock(text='Based on the knowledge base search, I found relevant information about applying fix packs to ODM Decision Center. Here's what you need to know:

## Additional Steps After Installing Fix Pack with Installation Manager

Yes, there are additional steps required after installing the fix pack with Installation Manager. The installation only updates the JAR libraries and application files, but you need to apply these updates to your running environment.

### Key Steps for Decision Center:

**1. Update the Decision Center Application**
- Update `jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear` in your application server
- Ensure class loading policies remain "parent last" for all ODM modules

**2. Reapply Customizations**
- Any customizations you made to descriptors or configurations must be reapplied to the updated EAR/WAR files
- Document and automate these customizations using scripts to make the process easier

**3. Redeploy if Necessary**
- If you redeploy the application, follow the ODM distribution configuration documentation to deploy all modules to your servers

### Before Updating (Important):

**For Sample Server Users:**
- Stop the sample server
- Backup databases in `<ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby` (resdb and rtsdb folders)
- After installation, restore the backup before restarting

**Note:** The fix pack installation updates files in:
- `<ODMInstallDir>/<Module>/lib` (JAR libraries)
- `<ODMInstallDir>/<Module>/applicationservers/<App Server>` (EAR/WAR applications)

### General Principle:
Applying a modification or fix pack does not require data migration - your projects and database remain the same. However, you must update the deployed applications on your servers with the updated files.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md > UPDATE DECISION CENTER]

⚠️ The document provides general guidance for ODM fix pack application but does not include version-specific instructions for 8.8.1.3. For detailed version-specific steps, consult the fix pack's readme file or the official ODM 8.8.1.3 documentation.')]

messages.result:
Based on the knowledge base search, I found relevant information about applying fix packs to ODM Decision Center. Here's what you need to know:

## Additional Steps After Installing Fix Pack with Installation Manager

Yes, there are additional steps required after installing the fix pack with Installation Manager. The installation only updates the JAR libraries and application files, but you need to apply these updates to your running environment.

### Key Steps for Decision Center:

**1. Update the Decision Center Application**
- Update `jrules-teamserver-<server>.ear` in your application server
- Ensure class loading policies remain "parent last" for all ODM modules

**2. Reapply Customizations**
- Any customizations you made to descriptors or configurations must be reapplied to the updated EAR/WAR files
- Document and automate these customizations using scripts to make the process easier

**3. Redeploy if Necessary**
- If you redeploy the application, follow the ODM distribution configuration documentation to deploy all modules to your servers

### Before Updating (Important):

**For Sample Server Users:**
- Stop the sample server
- Backup databases in `<ODM_HOME>/shared/data/derby` (resdb and rtsdb folders)
- After installation, restore the backup before restarting

**Note:** The fix pack installation updates files in:
- `<ODMInstallDir>/<Module>/lib` (JAR libraries)
- `<ODMInstallDir>/<Module>/applicationservers/<App Server>` (EAR/WAR applications)

### General Principle:
Applying a modification or fix pack does not require data migration - your projects and database remain the same. However, you must update the deployed applications on your servers with the updated files.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/08ceb9a6.md > UPDATE DECISION CENTER]

⚠️ The document provides general guidance for ODM fix pack application but does not include version-specific instructions for 8.8.1.3. For detailed version-specific steps, consult the fix pack's readme file or the official ODM 8.8.1.3 documentation.

    22→Ensure that there is only one instance of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS in your library concatenations, and that they are at the correct z/OS level.

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_LwvOfcFCZRJo86WvzCvyFb', content='     1→---
     2→id: "aeb3eb71"
     3→title: "DUMP 0Cx 0C4 0C1 FFFF FFFFFFFF PROGRAM CHECK FINDING locating PSW REGISTER REGIS"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/38/doc_4"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→DUMP 0Cx 0C4 0C1 FFFF FFFFFFFF PROGRAM CHECK FINDING locating PSW REGISTER REGISTERS KERNEL ERROR TABLE DFHAP0001 MSGDFHAP0001; 5655S9700 R660 660 R600 600 HCI6600 5655-S97 5655S97 CICS MVS KIXINFO TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ You receive a program check that has an offset X'FFFFFFFF' in a CICS Transaction Server for z/OS (CICS TS) V4.1 region. For example, DFHAP0001 An abend (code 0C4/AKEA) has occurred at offset X'FFFFFFFF' in module DFHAMP. The X'FFFFFFFF' indicates that CICS was unable establish the location of the program check. So, you would like to locate the PSW and registers in your CICS system dump.
    14→
    15→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    16→If you have a system dump from a CICS TS V4.2 or V5.1 region, see locating the PSW for a program check in a CICS TS V5.3, V5.2, V5.1 or V4.2 system dump [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21610631].
    17→
    18→If you have a system dump from a CICS TS V3.2 or lower region, see locating the PSW for a program check in a CICS TS V3 system dump [http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21176381].
    19→
    20→If you have a system dump that contains your CICS TS V4.1 address space, you can do the following to locate the PSW and the registers for the program check:
    21→
    22→ 1.  Enter option 0 from the IPCS primary option menu to display the IPCS default values panel.
    23→ 2.  Enter DSNAME('xxxxx.xxxxx.xxxx') to the right of Source where xxxxx.xxxxx.xxxx is the dump dataset name. Then enter Enter and F3 to return to the IPCS primary option menu.
    24→ 3.  Enter option 6 from the IPCS primary option menu to display the IPCS Subcommand Entry panel.
    25→ 4.  Enter IPCS command verbx dfhpdxxx 'ke' where xxx is the version and release for the CICS dump. The value of xxx is 660 for CICS TS V4.1. This command will format the dump and display to the Kernel Domain KE_TASK Summary.
    26→ 5.  Enter f *YES* to get to the running task that had the program check. There may be more than one. In the example below, there is one task with *YES* under ERROR (KE_NUM 008E). Figure 1.1
    27→     [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=1]
    28→
    29→
    30→
    31→ 6.  Make a note of the KE_NUM, TCA_ADDR and the TRANSID of the tasks in error.
    32→ 7.  Enter f table to find the KE Domain Error Table Summary. This is a summary containing the last 50 abends in the region since it was started. Figure 1.2
    33→     [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=2] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=2]
    34→
    35→
    36→
    37→ 8.  Enter ip st sys on the command line to determine the local time and date that the dump was taken.
    38→ 9.  Make a note of the ERR_NUM associated with the program check that has an ERR_TIME matching the time the dump was taken and a KE_NUM matching the KE_NUM found in the Kernel Domain KE_TASK Summary. If there is more than one program check for the same ERR_TIME and KE_NUM, focus on the first program check. The other program checks are probably a result of the first program check.
    39→ 10. Enter f 'Number: xxxxxxxx' where xxxxxxxx is the ERR_NUM of the program check (from Figure 1.2) you have decided to focus on. This will find the entry in the KE Domain Error table for the error number you specify.
    40→
    41→     Figure 1.3
    42→     [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=3] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=3]
    43→ 11. For CICS TS V4.1 compare the addresses at offset X'34' and offset X'10C' in the KERNEL ERROR DATA. The addresses are the second word of the CICS PSW and the MVS PSW, respectively. If the addresses are different, use the MVS PSW and registers. Otherwise, use the CICS PSW and registers.
    44→
    45→     The CICS PSW starts at offset x'30' and is 3 words in length. The CICS registers, 0 through 15, start at offset X'48' and each register is 2 words in length.
    46→     The MVS PSW starts at offset x'108' and is 3 words in length. The MVS registers, 0 through 15, start at offset x'120' and each register is 2 words in length.
    47→
    48→
    49→ 12. Use F8 to scroll down to see the formatted CICS PSW and registers as shown in Figure 1.4 below. IPCS CICS VERBX will format the MVS PSW and registers if the MVS PSW is different from the CICS PSW. If the PSWs are the same as in this example, then CICS VERBX does not duplicate the information.
    50→
    51→     Figure 1.4
    52→     [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=4] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21424768&aid=4]
    53→
    54→     CICS VERBX will attempt to determine the failing module from the PSW and will display the module name and offset if possible. The offline dump formatter uses more information than the original failure message, and so often, when the original failure message is unhelpful (offset FFFFFFFF in module) the dump formatter will be more informative.
    55→
    56→     By scrolling down from the panel in Figure 1.4, you will often get the failing module printed from the start to the interrupt address plus 256 bytes. CICS VERBX will also assume the values in the general registers are addresses and print the storage before and after these addresses, using both 31 bit and 24 bit addresses.
    57→
    58→Once you know the PSW, you can do the following to determine the module that the failure is occurring in:  1. Enter option 1 from the IPCS primary option menu to Browse the dump data set.
    59→ 2. Enter nnnnnnnn into the Pointer Address field where nnnnnnnn is the second word of the PSW. If the first digit of the PSW address is greater than 8, subtract 8 from it. In the example above, the PSW address is AE500B86. Therefore, you would use 2E500B86.
    60→ 3. If the storage displays, enter F7 to scroll up until you see an eye catcher for a load module. Load module names are usually followed by a date and time stamp. Calculate an offset within the module by subtracting the load point from the PSW address. This is the offset where the abend occurred.
    61→ 4. If "storage not available" displays, enter ip where nnnnnnnn. If the module has been loaded by the operating system from the LPA or Nucleus, this will display the module name and the offset within the module.
    62→
    63→Now that you know the module name and the offset, search for a known problem on the CICS Support page [http://www.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/Overview/Software/Other_Software/CICS_Transaction_Server]. Use keywords such as the following for a search argument: 'DFHAP0001 DFHAPDM 0C4'.
    64→
    65→RELATED INFORMATION
    66→ Finding where a program check occurred [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSGMCP_4.1.0/com.ibm.cics.ts.doc/dfhs1/topics/dfhs1l8.html]
    67→
    68→
    69→
    70→PRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM
    71→ CICS/TS CICS TS CICS Transaction Server

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_l5sfsuUe8b63tlqy1yjsyX', content='     1→---
     2→id: "6d9ea95a"
     3→title: "0C4 ABENDS0C4 BPXP018I DFHKE1800 MSGDFHSR0601 MSGDFHSR0622 5655M1500 R640 640 R4"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/38/doc_1"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→0C4 ABENDS0C4 BPXP018I DFHKE1800 MSGDFHSR0601 MSGDFHSR0622 5655M1500 R640 640 R400 400 R650 650 R500 500 HCI6400 HCI6500 5655-M15 5655M15 kixinfo retention32 TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
    11→
    12→PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
    13→ Your CICS Transaction Server for z/OS (CICS TS) region receives messages:
    14→DFHSR0622 An attempt to overwrite the ERDSA has caused the abend which follows
    15→DFHSR0601 Program interrupt occurred with system task TCP in control
    16→DFHKE1800 ABNORMAL TERMINATION OF CICS IS COMPLETE
    17→
    18→SYMPTOM
    19→DFHSR0622 [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/cicsts/v3r2/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.cics.ts.messages.doc/cics_mc/dfhsr/SR0622.html] An attempt to overwrite the ERDSA has caused the abend which follows
    20→DFHSR0601 [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/cicsts/v3r2/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.cics.ts.messages.doc/cics_mc/dfhsr/SR0601.html] Program interrupt occurred with system task TCP in control
    21→DFHKE1800 [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/cicsts/v3r2/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.cics.ts.messages.doc/cics_mc/dfhke/KE1800.html] ABNORMAL TERMINATION OF CICS IS COMPLETE
    22→
    23→CAUSE
    24→Program check in Compuware module DBUGPCPA. CICS ends since the program check occurs in a module that is running under the main CICS terminal control task.
    25→
    26→DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM
    27→You examine a system dump on the DFHSR0601 [http://publibfi.boulder.ibm.com/cgi-bin/bookmgr/BOOKS/dfhg4c00/1.87?ACTION=MATCHES&REQUEST=dfhsr0601&TYPE=FUZZY&SHELF=dfhasj00&DT=20070614214024&CASE=&searchTopic=TOPIC&searchText=TEXT&searchIndex=INDEX&rank=RANK&ScrollTOP=FIRSTHIT#FIRSTHIT] message and find that the running task is TCP CSTP.
    28→
    29→The ABEND0C4 occurs in Compuware module DBUGPCPA on a STM instruction: 90ECD00C. This is because register 13 is pointing to "read only" or key 0 storage. In this case, it is pointing to module EYU9NA01.
    30→
    31→You back up in the CICS trace and find that the TCP task was in the middle of processing a losterm error for a terminal attached to CICS.
    32→
    33→RESOLVING THE PROBLEM
    34→[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21272740&aid=1]Compuware [http://www.compuware.com/] has provided fix XDPF265.
    35→
    36→PRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM
    37→ CICS/TS CICS TS CICS Transaction Server

[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='tooluse_yLKRivcebhYfGinpVhhzIU', content='     1→---
     2→id: "50359fd1"
     3→title: "z/os  A FIX IS AVAILABLE"
     4→source_repo: "rungalileo/ragbench"
     5→source_path: "techqa/test/38/doc_3"
     6→tags: [ragbench, techqa]
     7→confidence: medium
     8→---
     9→
    10→z/os  A FIX IS AVAILABLE
    11→Obtain the fix for this APAR.
    12→
    13→SUBSCRIBE
    14→You can track all active APARs for this component.
    15→
    16→APAR STATUS
    17→ * CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR.
    18→
    19→
    20→
    21→
    22→ERROR DESCRIPTION
    23→ *  Immediately after an EXCI program purges some transactions, the
    24→   region receives:
    25→   DFHLD0002 A severe error (code X'1927') has occurred in module
    26→   DFHLDLD1
    27→   followed by:
    28→   DFHPC0401 CICST20 Abend AEXZ issued by TCP task.
    29→   After issuing DFHPC0401, the CICS asid hangs and had to be
    30→   canceled.
    31→   An abend0c4 occurs in program DFHZACT at offset x'1FA' on a
    32→   TM instruction 9180 80B4 with reg8 invalid.  Reg8 contains
    33→   x'40404040' and has been loaded from regA +x'230'.  Register
    34→   10 does not point to a valid TCTTE.
    35→   The problem is that the CATD task was purged while in the middle
    36→   of SYNCPOINTing the deletion of the terminal. The abend was
    37→   deferred until after returning from DFHSPP.  At that point, the
    38→   TCTTE has been successfully committed.  DFHAPLI then abends the
    39→   task.  This drives the handle abend exit of DFHZATD which calls
    40→   DELETE_TERMINAL_ERROR.  A SYNCPOINT ROLLBACK is issued but the
    41→   TCTTE is not re-instated because deletion of the TCTTE has been
    42→   successfully committed.
    43→   The code assumed that it has a TCTTE now and put it back on the
    44→   activate scan queue to retry the terminal delete.
    45→   When DFHZACT runs, it finds the TCTTE that is not valid
    46→   resulting in an ABEND0C4 in DFHZACT.
    47→
    48→
    49→
    50→
    51→
    52→
    53→LOCAL FIX
    54→
    55→PROBLEM SUMMARY
    56→ *  ****************************************************************
    57→   * USERS AFFECTED: All.                                         *
    58→   ****************************************************************
    59→   * PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: Abend0C4 in DFHZACT at X'1FE' following *
    60→   *                      abend of CATD task. CICS abends with    *
    61→   *                      DFHSR0601 Program interrupt occurred    *
    62→   *                      with system task TCP in control.        *
    63→   ****************************************************************
    64→   * RECOMMENDATION:                                              *
    65→   ****************************************************************
    66→   While deleting an autoinstalled terminal, CATD gets forcepurged
    67→   during SYNCPOINT of the deleted terminal. The AKC3 abend is
    68→   deferred and on return to DFHZATD control passes to the abend
    69→   handler routine ZATDDTEE.
    70→   Routine DELETE_TERMINAL_ERROR is called to perform a SYNCPOINT
    71→   ROLLBACK to restore the terminal and to place the TCTTE back on
    72→   activate scan queue so that the delete can be retried.
    73→   However, in this case the terminal had already been
    74→   deleted successfully and the TCTTE storage freed and reused.
    75→   When TCP ran subsequently and processed the activate scan queue
    76→   this reused TCTTE storage caused an abend0C4 in DFHZACT. This
    77→   led to message DFHSR0601 'Program interrupt occurred with system
    78→   task TCP in control' being issued and CICS being terminated.
    79→   However other unpredictable results could occur.
    80→   Additional keywords: AbendAKC3 DFHZATD ZACT Abends0C4 S0C4 0C4
    81→                        AKC3
    82→
    83→
    84→
    85→
    86→
    87→
    88→PROBLEM CONCLUSION
    89→ *  DFHZATD has been altered to check if the terminal still
    90→   exists before rescheduling for deletion.
    91→
    92→
    93→
    94→
    95→
    96→
    97→TEMPORARY FIX
    98→ *  FIX AVAILABLE BY PTF ONLY
    99→

[TextBlock(text='Based on the knowledge base search, I found a highly relevant document that addresses your specific issue.

## Answer

Your CICS region is failing during startup due to a **mismatch in z/OS levels between Language Environment modules** (CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA).

**Cause:**
There is a mismatch in z/OS levels between Language Environment modules, CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA.

**Resolution:**
Ensure that there is only one instance of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS in your library concatenations, and that they are at the correct z/OS level.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/907e9a49.md > PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) / CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

---

⚠️ The document confirms the error messages (DFHAP1203I and DFHSR0601) and the general cause related to Language Environment module mismatches after z/OS upgrades. However, it does not provide specific details about:
- The 0C1 abend code in the Debug Tool module EQA10OSM
- Detailed troubleshooting steps for identifying which library concatenations contain the mismatched modules
- Specific commands or procedures to verify the z/OS levels of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS

For detailed troubleshooting of the 0C1 abend in EQA10OSM, you may need to consult IBM Debug Tool documentation or open a support case.')]

messages.result:
Based on the knowledge base search, I found a highly relevant document that addresses your specific issue.

## Answer

Your CICS region is failing during startup due to a **mismatch in z/OS levels between Language Environment modules** (CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA).

**Cause:**
There is a mismatch in z/OS levels between Language Environment modules, CEECCICS and CEEPLPKA.

**Resolution:**
Ensure that there is only one instance of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS in your library concatenations, and that they are at the correct z/OS level.

[Source: docs/ragbench-techqa/907e9a49.md > PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) / CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

---

⚠️ The document confirms the error messages (DFHAP1203I and DFHSR0601) and the general cause related to Language Environment module mismatches after z/OS upgrades. However, it does not provide specific details about:
- The 0C1 abend code in the Debug Tool module EQA10OSM
- Detailed troubleshooting steps for identifying which library concatenations contain the mismatched modules
- Specific commands or procedures to verify the z/OS levels of CEEPLPKA and CEECCICS

For detailed troubleshooting of the 0C1 abend in EQA10OSM, you may need to consult IBM Debug Tool documentation or open a support case.

query: Java.io.NotSerializableException in WAS We are experiencing the Java.io.NotSerializableException exception. I see this error: WTRN0047E:java.io.NotSerializableException. Anyone experienced this before?
answer:
Perfect! I found detailed information about the `WTRN0047E: java.io.NotSerializableException` error in WebSphere Application Server. Here's what the documentation says:

## Problem

The `WTRN0047E: java.io.NotSerializableException` error occurs when persistent sessions or PMI (Performance Monitoring Infrastructure) is enabled, and an object that doesn't implement the `java.io.Serializable` or `java.io.Externalizable` interface is placed in the HTTPSession.

**Example error:**
```
[10/4/02 10:11:10:172 EDT] 28b7c18b SessionContex X WTRN0047E:
java.io.NotSerializableException: COM.ibm.db2.jdbc.app.DB2Connection
```

## Root Cause

The class name at the end of the exception is the object that doesn't implement the serializable interface. This object is typically:
- An attribute placed directly into the session object, OR
- An object referenced by an attribute of the session object

## Resolution

**Make the object serializable:**

All objects placed in the HTTPSession must implement the `java.io.Serializable` or `java.io.Externalizable` interface.

Example:
```java
public class MyObject implements Serializable {
}
```

## Troubleshooting Steps

**Use SessionInspectServlet to identify the problematic attribute:**

1. The servlet `com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet` is already shipped with WebSphere and in the classpath

2. Define a servlet/uri entry for SessionInspectServlet (or enable `ServeServletsByClassnameEnabled=true` in `ibm-web-ext.xmi`)

3. Restart your web module

4. Navigate your application to populate the session

5. Access the SessionInspectServlet via: `webapp_context_root/servlet/com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.httpsession.SessionInspectServlet`

The servlet will show you:
- All attributes in the session
- Which attributes are serializable vs non-serializable
- Size of each serializable attribute
- Whether serializable attributes are properly implemented

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/2a8bfc72.md > PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) / CAUSE / RESOLVING THE PROBLEM]

---

**Related APAR:** There's also a known issue (APAR PK29441) where notification code repeatedly logs `java.io.NotSerializableException` when it fails to serialize objects. This was fixed in WebSphere 6.0.2.15 and 6.1.0.3.

[来源: docs/ragbench-techqa/751894c8.md > PROBLEM SUMMARY / PROBLEM CONCLUSION]
